text: A good example of picking something and doing it well. In this case, bagel sandwiches.for breakfast and lunch. The bagels are fresh and the deli meats/cheeses are good quality. Tucked within a nondescript strip mall on south boulevard, you've driven past it a thousand times, but it's worth a stop.
Long time to wait to get a mediocre bacon egg and cheese on a bagel different from what I requested
Love this place! Yummy bagels and an endless variety of sandwiches!

This is not a place I probably would have stopped at had I not bought a living social voucher. So glad I did, love the casual atmosphere and the food was great. The giant peanut butter cup cookie I bought was to die for!

I used to live in Charlotte for 2 years. The opening of Owen's within walking distance of our house changed my world, and made me a much happier Charlottean. 
Ambling over on Saturday and/or Sunday mornings to read the paper and munch on a Hangover Helper was the best part of my week. The fact that they included a fountain soda along with an egg, cheddar and sausage (that's what I got on it, anyway) onion bagel sandwich immediately impressed me regarding how well they knew what cured my hangovers.
Oh, and the Chia Bagel, Hot Tuna Meltdown, and Banana Surprise are other favorite menu items.  
I'm no longer a resident, but Owen's is always one of my first stops back in town. Last week we were in Charlotte for four days - four days made great by three lunches at Owen's!

Great little shop in South End.  Excellent selection of bagel sandwiches.  Line can take awhile if early weekend morning - suggest calling order in ahead of time if possible.  Will definitely be back soon.

Definitely a delicious bagel. The bagels come steamed so they're nice and soft and make for a great sandwich. 

The atmosphere inside the restaurant is great, there is interesting writing up and down all the walls and plenty to look at while you're waiting for your food to be prepared. It was a nice day so we ate outside at one of the picnic tables they had there.

The staff was friendly and helpful and made it a pleasant experience.

It's a little hard to find off the road so keep your eyes open and to get inside you have to go into the "Pavilion" entrance and walk by a nail salon (...ugh to all the smells that entails).

I'll certainly be back soon.

Ordered an everything bagel with cream cheese and was disgusted to find egg, peanut butter AND a sunflower seed in the aluminum foil. NOT how I wanted my Saturday morning to start. No bagel in Charlotte compares to Poppy's Bagels.
So delish! The food was amazing and the place is super cool. The owner is so sweet, which is an awesome plus!

Owen's Bagel & Deli has committed war crimes against my taste buds.  These are the worst bagels I've ever had that weren't purchased from a supermarket or a dirty food truck.  I took two bites and threw out my very expensive breakfast.

Ignore the other reviews for Owen's.  It's clear that these people have no idea what a bagel is supposed to taste like.  This place is a joke.  Let's get specific:

#1)  Flavor:  there isn't any.  These things have all the excitement of wonder bread.

#2)  Texture:  Mush.   Bagel's are supposed to be soft, dense and chewy on the inside with a crispy but yielding skin on the outside.   At Owen's you get a steamed pile of mushy goo.  Yes, STEAMED... more on that in a moment.

#3)  Toppings:  As any true New Yorker would do, I ordered my bagel with cream cheese a lox (that's smoked salmon for you North Carolina natives).  The fish they served me smelled really bad- not fresh at all... but what can you expect from an establishment that prides itself on Boar's Head meats?  Sidenote: Boar's Head is the Hunt's ketchup of deli meats- an inferior product that somehow maintains astonishing market share, despite offending anyone with taste buds.

Okay, so back to the part where they STEAMED my bagel:  I had asked for a TOASTED onion bagel, because that's the proper way to warm a bagel.  The moron behind the counter nodded dumbly and didn't mention that apparently Owen's doesn't OWN A TOASTER!   Instead, without informing me, she STEAMS my bagel, turning it instantly into soft, gooey mess, without even a hint of the crispy crust that the bagel may have started with.  If any heating method is the exact opposite of toasting a bagel, it's STEAMING a bagel.  It's like steaming a pizza or a hamburger... you just don't do it. 

If I could give Owen's Bagel's a rating with negative stars, that's what I'd be doing right now. 

After throwing out the worst bagel ever from Owen's, I drove a few minutes away to Bruegger's.   Sure, Bruegger's in a boring chain, but they at least know how to make a bagel that doesn't suck, and they understand how to work a toaster.  Also their smoked salmon was fresh.  I never thought I'd recommend them over an independently owned Bagel shop, but in this case, I have to.

Years ago, my friend Jen raved about the steamed bagel sandwiches that she'd eaten while attending school in Ohio.  She couldn't contain her excitement about Bagel & Deli coming to Charlotte, and right down the road from her house no less!  I'll admit that I was somewhat dubious about the idea of something tasty coming from Ohio, and the idea of steaming a bagel just seemed strange and inappropriate, like eating chili on spaghetti noodles.  Steamed bread?  I cringed at the thought of the microwave sandwiches I ate in elementary school.  Boy, was I wrong.  Steamed bagels ARE good.  I like them, I like them, Sam I Am.  

If you're heading to Owens for the first time, prepare yourself for being overwhelmed by the menu options.  You're going to go all deer-in-the-headlights and stuff.  Not only is the printed menu extensive, but there are construction paper signs hanging on a line displaying some of their more creatively titled menu items; hung there to distract you and cause you to inexplicably stare for minutes on end.   There is a seemingly endless list of fantastic sandwiches for you to choose from, or you can create and name your very own bagel sandwich creation.  

I've only had one sub-par experience here but it was during a weird time of day when I'd imagine the third stringers were in the game.  I think that the vast majority of people are like me and enjoy eating at Owens after a long night out with friends, but this is a great place for breakfast or lunch any old day.
Great service and food. All of the employees are so nice. My bagel was toasted just right.

This place is the best. Cool, eclectic, local vibe. Great food! Very friendly staff. I had the Paul Reuben for lunch, and it was the bomb! Price is right too! Highly recommend a visit. Right across from Mr. K's but its tucked back so you could almost miss it, but don't!
It was just ok. Clearly workers didn't want to be there at 9am on Sunday. Very funky.  Tons of toys for little kids which would be nice if I had em. Got ET bagel with cream cheese. Not impressed.

OWen's is my go-to place for lunch. For less than $10 you can get a great sandwich, chips and a drink. They have a large selection of sandwich choices, so you are likely to get exactly what you want. I read the other reviews and would like to note that THEY HAVE A TOASTER YES! Their policy is to steam everything, so you have to be clear if you do not want that. 

My fave is their wraps. A bagel all the time is a lot of calories and they have all the veggies i want for a delish wrap. I also recently tried their potato salad and LOVE IT! Compared to the other options in the neighborhood, this is the most affordable, locally owned, healthy option available. And they are always open to making me whatever I am in the mood for that day. Great staff! See you soon :)

My top menu choices:
Their Lox sandwich is AWESOME (they add cucumbers yum)
Dilworth (cream cheese and veggies)
WRAPS!! (they will put anything they have)

They also carry tea CHEERWINE Diet Dr.Pepper and keep hot sauce behind the counter. All this place needs is more business!
Reasonable prices and tasty too.  I get the chicken salad on a bagel and have been pleased.  Service is also upbeat and inviting.

Having a place to go for a real ny bagel is important, but a bagel deli that also offers creative sandwich combinations, friendly staff, and is convenient to my office job is why this place gets 5 stars! Was going to do 4 because they didn't tell me they had run out of sprouts for the Hot Piece of Ash sandwich, but, way worth it!!

As a admitted bagel-snob, I seriously don't understand the hype about this place. Definitely not a New York-quality bagel if you're looking for that, and not as cheap as it should be. The fillings aren't bad, but the bagels are just plain bad. They're not dense and don't crunch on the bottom like a true bagel should. I actually went twice because I wanted to give them a second chance and see if maybe I just went on a bad day. The second time was just as bad. Not worth the trip or the money.

I LOVE OWEN'S BAGEL! They have the best bagels in town. My favorite lunch bagel is the Tonya Harding. The best thing about their bagels is they are steamed before serving. Make anything a combo at lunch with chips & drink. A very ecclectic dining room with mix matched chairs & tables with customer's graffiti on the wall.
Try your bagel steamed. Love the atmosphere.

Best bagel sandwich EVER! I go to Owen's every weekend for their "Mark Cuban Lookalike" sandwich because I am seriously addicted. The avocado is always perfectly ripe on this perfectly hot bagel sandwich. Their cheesy grits are the best in Charlotte. One day they ran out of grits and we were very disappointed because our 14 month old daughter loves them. They quickly made an extra batch just for us! The manager brought it to our table herself. Good food and great people!!!

They always have the best tasting bagels for a morning pick me up, their staff is always so nice and helpful. I'm slowly making my way through their menu, but really the classic steamed bagel with cream cheese is best in my book.
Owen's Bagel is THE BEST!! What an insanely awesome menu, and everything on it is so tasty. The team there is also out of this world. My day is always better after a visit to Owen's.

I hate that I have to rate this place as 1 star, but it has to be done.  I was so overwhelmingly disappointed with my experience.  I met my husband for lunch and we were both excited to try this place out.  Everywhere we have lived we have found a local bagel place that has had awesome breakfast and lunch sandwiches.  And I love love bagels.  So I was really expecting something great.  

Well we walked in and were slammed by the disgusting smell of the nail salon next door.  The whole little shopping center is indoors but the stores themselves are open-air, if that makes sense.  The place next door to Owen's is a nail salon, who does that?!  The last thing I want to smell is chemicals while I'm eating lunch...well maybe dog poo would be worse.  Anyways, the menu looks great, we place our orders, and they are out of almost every bagel.  It was noon and I thought that lunch would be a major deal there and they would have plenty of bread for the only thing they are serving.  So the sandwiches take forever and we go to pay and I order us each a combo with potato salad and a drink.  This is what the guy at the register says "We don't have that."  And then nothing else and just stares at me.  Umm ok so I ask "Why is it on your menu?"  He looks at me with the most dumb and confused look on his face.  He picks up a menu and looks at it.  Then he says that they have new owners now and this menu is from the old owners.  Well make some new menus dummy!  They are obviously homemade and could be done in 10 minutes.  And how can you not know what's on your menu?!?  Then I ask what they have for sides and he looks in the display case and says "We have hummus, chicken salad, and tuna salad."  WHAT?!  Jeez this is weird.  I ask "Those are your sides??"  I guess it finally clicks in his head what I'm looking for and says they have chips.  Ok I'll take chips, just get me outta here, I'm getting a headache from the nail polish fumes.  To top it all off, the sandwiches were just ok.  I am not a fan of steaming the bagels.  I like when they are crispy outside and chewy inside, the epitome of a bagel in my opinion.  These were just straight chewy.  And I'm pretty sure the place was not very clean.  The girl making the sandwiches was barehanded and answering the phone in the middle of her sandwich making.  Nasty.  

I'm sorry for the rant but thank you for listening.  I hope this place can turn it around but it's going to take a lot to get me to go back here for lunch.  Bummer.

Haven't been here in a while but love their bagels! It's definitely something that us Charlotteans are not used to... what a bagel steamed and made into a sandwich? The melty amazing gooeyness of the cheese on their bagels just makes you want to come back for more. We are so used to Einstein and Brueggers bagels down here. Don't get me wrong I'm fine with a bagel and cream cheese but Owens is different! It's in it's own category for bagels. Also, it's not a franchise, yet.  I remember coming here a few years ago when they first opened their doors and saw "If" by Rudyard Kipling written from top to bottom on one of the walls it brought back memories of my childhood and having to memorize that poem.  Overall great place for breakfast or lunch and close to uptown Charlotte right in South end.

Best NY bagels down south! They actually ship their bagels from NY and bake them in their restaurant. Besides their delicious bagels, they sell this AMAZING brand of cold brew coffee, called Pure Intensions.  The coffee is locally brewed and packaged, and is only available at a few stores/restaurants besides Owen's Bagels.  Great food, drinks and service!!! This place is the locals favorite:)

Expect a line out the door on Saturday and Sunday mornings, but well worth the wait!

Awesome coffee and amazing bagels! Great staff

I always get the Phish.

Love this place!

I popped into Owen's after leaving a "retro diner" that had horrible service and I never received my meal (Mattie's, check your staff). This was a setup for Owen's to some degree. If the service was bad, I was already PO'd so I'd probably take it out on them. However, if the service was good, the contrast would make them look like they served manna from heaven. Well, here is how it went... great! First off, the place is sorta weird and unconventional... a big plus for me. The menu was varied and options a plenty.  In addiation, they use Boar's head products, so I know they care. Placed the order after a short wait, and recieved it in about five minutes. Everything was yummy and we were happy campers. Rita's BLT gets a thumbs up and my sesame seed, egg and Colby bagel was a belly pleaser also.  Added bonus, people graffiti the walls with Sharpie pens. I exacted my revenge toward the retro dump . . . killed two birds with one stone ( and two bagels).

Wish I could echo everyone else's positive experience, but it was just OK for us.  Maybe they were having an off day, but everything seemed kind of bland.  The bagels, the cream cheese, the butter, even the coffee.  We were there in the morning and the bagels didn't taste very fresh.  Also not a huge fan of the way they sell their coffee- $2.50 for a giant cup + free refills.  I drink a small cup of coffee and would prefer to just pay for that.  It's also hard to ignore the strong smell coming from the nail place even when the nail place is closed.  Don't think I've met a bagel (from a bagel shop) that I didn't like, but today threw most of one away.
Best place to get breakfast in South End!

Owens is a very good spot for bagels. It is: 

A) Local. 
B) Decorated with a hipster kind of vibe with drawings all over the space and random memorabilia all over the place. 
C) A ton of great and creative choices for bagels. You will find something on the menu with a funny name. 

There isn't a lot more to say other than it is very crowded on the weekends and for a good reason, it is delicious. It could definitely use more seating and better parking but whatever it is still worth it.

Sandwich and bagel were good. Annoying, however, to pay nearly $7 for a sandwich and a plain bagel only to see the guy walk out the back carrying three bags of store-bought bagels and dumping them into the bin. At least try to trick us into thinking they're fresh by bringing the bin to the back and dumping the bagels there. Again, the sandwich is good (I got the Wilford). But the bagels aren't fresh and they're just plain generic store bought so save yourself the money and just buy a bag of bagels for the half the price.

I've been to Owen's a handful of times since moving to South End last year. They've always had good bagels, but each time I left wanting a little more in terms of service. But not today.

I don't know what they've changed, but my experience today was top notch. They had at least 10 employees working behind the counter, they've installed a new ticket system with order numbers (much more efficient!), and the coffee was 100% stocked. I was even asked by two different employees how my day was going! They've definitely stepped service up and it shows. Thanks, Owen's!

Breakfast sandwich fail

I was excited to try the local privately owned bagel shop, but this place was was unbelievably unimpressive. They use pre-cooked eggs. Wtf?? Are you kidding me? I would go to dunkin if I wanted to eat a rubbery pre-cooked egg square. Local shops are supposed to be better than chains, right? How hard is it to cook an egg? Also, the coffee is served in styrofoam cups, and the steamed bagels have a cheap hotel breakfast consistency. It looks like I'll just have to go to the chain places as long as I'm in Charlotte.

Does New York City know about Owen's?

Owen's is Charlotte's hidden gem. Seriously, it's almost impossible to find. If you're having trouble, go to Polished in South End. It's right across the hall inside the Pavilion.

Once you're inside, there are a variety of bagels, cream cheeses and sandwich options to choose from and, really, you can't go wrong, although I wish they cooked their eggs to order. If you can't decide, you can always get the "lottery" bagel. It's $6.50 for a bagel sandwich of the staff member's choice with chips and a fountain drink. I've never had a bad one yet!

A few insider tips...
First off, get your bagel steamed instead of toasted. I know, it's crazy, but it's AMAZING.
Second, at Owen's a bagel with everything on it isn't called an ET or an everything bagel, but a "combo" bagel.

One combo, steamed, with butter, please!

I used Owen's just this week to bring bagels to my co-workers for a morning meeting.  My planning was not exactly perfect as I called at 8:01am and ordered 40 bagels for an 8:30am pickup.  Again- not my finest hour.    

To give you my backstory- I stop by Owen's any chance I can (time permitting) when I come uptown.  Nothing beats a bagel ("Jake Deli Home" personal favorite) and a hot cup of coffee (Snickerdoodle when they have it).  My experience has always been 5 star.  More often than not Pam is behind the counter and is friendly as can be.  But this morning I was ordering for 35 of my friends...and I gave them 29 minutes notice. (#queue the scary music.... dum....dum.....DUMMMMMMM!!!!!)

The lady who took my order (can't remember her name) never once gave me the cliche' answer of "We need at least an hour's notice for an order of this size."  Instead she said "No problem!  We'll have them ready at 8:30."  BOOM!!!

I arrived at 8:34 (traffic ya know) to find my bagels/spreads/flatware/napkins all boxed up and ready to go!  Did I already say BOOM?  Well try this one: #nailedit!

I was in my office and had everything set up before 9:00. The bagels were a big hit.  mAdPrOpS to Owen's!

If you've never been you need to give them a try.  The menu is classic and not something you'd find at a Panera or an Einstein's.  A non-commercial really, really, REALLY good place to eat!

Awesome bagels. The only place I know that they can steam or toast your bagel. Great food. Last time I used their water machine, it tasted funny, so I never get drinks there, but the bagels are WONDERFUL
There's a long line but it moves super quickly! Loved the bagel options and the deli is really fresh

I don't think I have anything to say that hasn't been said about Owen's already, but this place is easily one of, if not my favorite breakfast place in Charlotte.

Great Bagels
Nice people
Free Wi-Fi

Not sure it gets much better.

Recommendation:  Hangover Helper on Sesame.
Love everything about this place. Amazing food, good music, great vibes. Go to weekend spot. Great hangover remedy .

Owen's is awesome.  About a 4.5, but it's local and interesting so it gets a round up!  It's a lot bigger inside than it looks from the outside and there is quite a selection of tasty bagel treats.  They have some really creative combinations that taste good too!  They have an option of toasted or steamed bagel.  My buddy asked what the steamed option meant and the server answered, "It's steamed and delicious...versus toasted and delicious!"

Good prices, great vibe, local flavor.  Bagel sandwiches are always better.

Was excited to find a local bagel shop with some personality.  25 minute ticket time for my toasted bagel with veggie cream cheese.  When I finally got it, there was plain cream cheese.  Asked to have if fixed.  The cashier was super nice and asked me if wanted to keep the messed up bagel since they were going to just throw it out anyways to make me a new one.  I declined his offer, and he gave me a new bagel very quickly.  Well I wished I had took him up on that offer because when I got my "new" toasted bagel it was very clear that they had just replaced the cream cheese.  The bagel was cold and slight hardened when I went to eat it.  Pretty disappointing overall, I really wanted to like these guys.

Re-writing my review for this place because of three main observations:

1. Owens is still just as awesome when I wrote my original review!! 
2. Ordered the Hangover Helper this past Sunday on the bagel it comes with, Onion. The onion is far superior than the wheat for this breakfast sandwich. Please ignore my last review and don't order it on Wheat. Live a little!
3. They serve Pure Intentions coffee which is locally roasted. It is freaking amazing. Make sure you get a cup!

Great and creative menu- both in name and recipe. Love the controlled chaos that is the menu board and decor- don't so much love the chaos that is ordering and awkwardly trying to find a place to stand and wait for your food. But believe me- I'd awkwardly squish in with many strangers for Owens.

By far the best bagel place in Charlotte! I drive 35 minutes here just for a bagel. The Mary's Bubby Grubby and Mama C's Lox bagels are my two favorites. I usually get jalapeño cream cheese or the chive cream cheese on the Mama C's Lox bagel and it really adds some delicious extra flavor to it. I add bacon to the Mary's Bubby Grubby bagel. Both are absolutely amazing and do not disappoint! Their menu is extensive for both breakfast bagels and lunch bagel sandwiches, so there truly is something for everyone. I would love to try more in the future, but I always have a hard time straying from my favorites! I would definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a quality bagel with lots of bagel sandwich options. You can also get a rewards card if you go here a lot and earn a free bagel every 10 trips!

delicious, absolutely delicious.  

i've only had the grubby bubby, twice, but it is damn good (egg, avocado, tomato and a HUGE slice of muenster on a fantasticly tasty bagel). the menu is huge and full of all sorts of delightful combinations to be wedged in between their top notch bagels.  i am going to try as many as i can when i can.  the atmosphere is cool, but the menu on strings behind the counter is very hard to read when it's your first time in there and you're conciousness is "elevated." 

love the place, def recommend it to out of towners that want some unique QC flavor.
Any New Yorker will agree this is the place for an amazing bagel sandwich. You can't go wrong with any of their options.!

Good bagels and variety. Prices are fair and decor is simple but fun (writing all over walls). My complaint would be the eggs and bacon. Unfortunately the eggs and bacon aren't made fresh and taste the same as fast food eggs and bacon.

I love Owen's. I have been going here for 6 years. The steamed bagels are among the best bagel sandwiches in Charlotte. Perfect for brunch or lunch. The staff are very friendly. Located in the pavilion, parking can be tricky. I usually park on the street behind the pavilion. Drink, chips and sandwich will run you $8 or $9. I usually stick with the Paul Ruben.
The most heavenly bagel in the world - no matter what you put inside to fill it, it'll always taste good here at Owens! I only want to eat steamed bagels from now on.
Excellent bagel sandwich...so many menu items to chose from, and the quality is delicious. Funky space, good service, highly recommend.

I cannot believe that I lived right down the road from Owen's for a year and a half and just discovered this little gem a few weeks ago.  This place is awesome!  The selection of bagel sandwiches is seemingly infinite.  There is truly something for everyone, whether you like veggies, BBQ, breakfast, or good ole lox and cream cheese.  Trying to pick just one can be overwhelming, but just stick to what you like and you will be good to go.  They have an enormous selection of hot teas and various other beverages, and they also have a cold case filled with deli salads and the like.  Super reasonably priced, amazing homemade bagels, totally chill atmosphere, and a friendly staff.  Can't ask for anything more in a neighborhood deli!

These steamed bagels are where it is at.  Get anything with bacon and I promise you won't be disappointed. Love how the walls are decorated with poems, promises, and manifestos of all sorts. To boot, Jeff Owens is a great guy, the kind you want to give business to... I was only in town for 10 days, and came here twice, so that should tell you something!

Yum. Yum. Yum.
Couldn't be happier.  First time there and they treated me like family.  We had a great time!  delicious one of a kind bagels in a eccentric colorful setting.
Went for the first time, wasn't sure what to get. I honestly don't remember what I got but the amount of turkey and how delicious it was, was great! Will definitely be back to try more!

It was fine but might go back again. I think I'm just wasn't expecting my sandwich to come out hot. It was roast beef sandwich. I might stop by if in the area but wouldn't go out of my way... basically what all my 3 stars entail.

The dining area was scary and smelled disgusting due to the open walled nail salon nearby.  The sandwich was amazing.  After having a seat I noticed a steady stream of pick-up orders.  This seems like the best way to go.
The sandwiches are great. The coffee... meh. It can get super busy on weekend mornings but the staff handles it well. And they play some pretty good tunes.

This was my go-to breakfast / bagel place in Charlotte. The first time one of my friends brought me here, I was pretty skeptical based on the exterior, but once I tried the Grubby Bubby I was hooked. I almost always got the Grubby Bubby with veggie cream cheese and it always hit the spot. I had never had a bagel steamed before Owen's and now I wish I could steam every bagel I eat. Lunch sandwiches are also good here; I always tried to pick a random one from the string of construction-paper sandwiches hung above the counter.

Best bagel place I've ever been to but if I'm being honest, I don't really eat too many bagels. With that being said, if I did I would head to Owen's every single time. It is so delicious. There are lots of options so there's something for everyone and even if you're not into all the creative flavors you can still get a plain bagel with cream cheese. The trick is that they steam their bagels which make them just soft enough. On this particular day we decided to get three bagels, the Phish, Bob-B-Cue and the Lottery. The lottery is where you let the geniuses at Owen's make you up a bagel. I'm not even sure what was all on it but it was amazing. The Phish which is my favorite had bacon, onions, bacon ranch cream cheese, pepper jack cheese, tomato and avocado on a asiago bagel. The BBQ bagel looked good as well but I wasn't looking to see what was on it because the phish and lottery were taking all my attention. My friend said that his BBQ bagel was amazing. In conclusion, venture here and try these amazing concoctions. You won't be disappointed. Oh and try to get there early seeing as how they fill up pretty quickly and it's hard to find seating. Other option is just call ahead and then pick up. Take your bagel sandwich home and devour it because I know you are.

My husband and I stopped in for a late lunch on Sunday. I had the bagel and lox, which was amazing. He had corned beef, which he says was so good he wants to go back for breakfast tomorrow. I quickly agreed, two thumbs up!

I step into Owen's after driving by twice and parking around back by the greenhouse. I shoulda read Todd's review and I would have had better luck! The interior is funky cool and makes you think local! 
I went with an everything bagel with turkey, egg,sprouts and avocado and a cup of joe. The coffee was average, so I figure the bagel was going to be awesome! My first bite into the bagel was nice but a bite of everything together made me wanting more, a lot more. The sprouts were a bit on the old side and turkey didnt make me think Boars Head. I searched out some hot sauce (packets) and that helped a little. I wish they had a few bottles of Red Hot or something instead of the tiny packets. 

I hope my third visit will be the charm!

I visited twice during the first weekend of November 2017 after a close friend who lives in the area recommended Owen's Bagel & Deli to me; I was not disappointed! So delicious!! They had such a large variety of bagels and bagel sandwiches available, although I will admit that I got the same Asiago cheese bagel sandwich both times that I went. Service was great, received food in a timely manner, and it was a lively atmosphere.

Only complaints are the fact that there's limited parking since it shares a small lot with other businesses in the building and the strip club next door, and then also that it's located in a building with free-standing and partition walls that don't reach the ceiling so the bagel shop smells strongly of the nail salon next door. Because of this, I fee like it's better for a grab and go kind of thing.

This place is fantastic. I'm from Massachusetts and they don't quite have bagels figured out down here yet but this place does. It's very hipster-ish but s cool little place, food and coffee is great. Highly recommend this place if you're looking for breakfast in south end.

Hit or miss - Sometimes there bagles are fresh and sometimes not so much!!


If your looking for a good ambiance it's not here. It's usually really packed with people.  Writting on the walls.  Strange Decore !


On my first Visit here..
1) got my order wrong
2) fixed it, but had a little taste of something from the counter.. Yuck. But, I was starving so I ate it.

I purchased a toasted plain bagel with light melted butter and Munster melted on the top, open faced. 

Bagel itself was pretty good.

The Grubby Bubby on everything bagel is great, loaded with avocado, tomato, cheese and egg. I ordered it with jalapeño cream cheese, which definitely would have amped the flavor and made it even better, but it was forgotten. 

Speaking of which, the ordering protocol seemed a bit haphazard. The lady making the sandwiches motioned me over and asked what I wanted while she continued to make other orders. Nothing was written down or entered into a computer, which is likely why the above mentioned jalapeño cream cheese was forgotten. 

I also tried the blueberry bagel with cream cheese and cinnamon sugar so I could get a glimpse of their sweeter offerings. This one I could do without. Nothing special or different than any other bagel shop. 

However, the texture of the grubby bubby "steamed" bagel was amazing. I think it must be toasted prior to the steaming, which results in a slight crispy, slightly chewy hot sandwich where even the insides are heated through. Absolutely delicious, and I WILL be back for more.

Certainly a unique experience.  With the helpful staff to guide me on my first adventure into the Owen's bagel way of life, it was a very pleasant experience.  It was some tasty stuff, the onion bagel sandwich I had was amazing, once I got used to it anyway.  The difference in cooking methods made it taste slightly different from other bagels I've had.  But it was all good, I can see why they've been around for so long.

I have heard lots about Owen's bagel and I tried the Mary's Grubby Bubby. Pros was the avocado and egg combo is delightful. The bialy bread was okay, but I'm a former New Yorker so I have high standards. I think the tomato was too chewy and watery, I would leave it off. The overall effects of the sandwich were good but not great like the hype I've heard. The dough was a little tough to chew. I would say my other fave bagel place in CLT-- Manhattan Bagel has better quality dough and more bagels like my foodie experiences in NYC.

One of my favorite breakfast places. It's local and it cool. What more do you need? Located next to Leather & Lace and across from Icehouse and Atherton Market, this bagel joint is good for all ages. The "named" sandwiches are good for a good laugh and make the entire menu worth reading. Bagels are steamed and made to order on your bagel flavor of choice, though many are set for you for ease with the specific menu item.

When you make your way into the place, make sure you go to the counter away from the cashier and order at the counter by the people making the bagels. There's usually a line and just make sure not to skip. Once you've ordered, move over to the register and get a drink/coffee if you desire. Then you wait...about 3-4 minutes while they prepare your food. They'll call out the bagel, not your name, so be alert :)

My favorite is a unique order....Mr. Turkey, no lettuce, add egg on wheat. It's funny now, since I've been there a few times, the minute I say no lettuce, they finish with "add egg on wheat". Guess I come here often...ha. Great weekend morning place to chill with an inexpensive breakfast. They have a nice patio area too, so make sure you check that out too!

Owens, I love you. I love your delicious bagels. I love all of your options. I love your staff, coffee, and coffee cake. 

Now for the bagel options. Booty bagel, you delicious peanut butter, honey, banana, thing, you - why are you so good? I literally have this bagel (and another for my real order) every single time I go. Do yourself a favor, try it. 

After that I always make so makeshift bagel or choose from their many options. You literally cannot go wrong. Also, try their coffee cake - yum! 

Not only are the bagels delicious but Owens is just fun to walk into. There is writing all over the walls and it just can't help but make you smile. If you're looking for a quick, delicious breakfast, look no further than Owens. Walk on hungry, walk out with a smile.

I have been to this place numerous times with it being right were I get my pedicures and around the corner from work, but last time I was in I had a "Bad Bagel"!! 

I had opted for the tuna fish with Pepper-jack cheese....I brought it back to my office and the tuna was just old or something it had a fishy taste to it and was pretty dry. In the past I have had the ham and cheese and that was really good on an Asiago Bagel!! I just love how the bagel sticks to the roof of my mouth like fresh white bread does!! 

The service has always been friendly and prompt guess I had gone in on an off day!!
Delicious bagels, avoid the fountain machine.   Tastes like they don't clean the lines.  Best bagel place in Charlotte.

Super delish bagels and the best thing to eat after a sad Bowl lost. Long lines are always good. Endless options for all and I ended up with the Gwacka Flacka Flame! They are steamed bagels it had turkey, lettuce, tomato, guacamole, and Siracha. I definitely recommend this place as it looked like both locals and visitors alike love it. Staff was awesome! They have ice coffee on tap.  I wish there was a shop in Nashville because I would be there.

Very cool spot.  Went at 11am last Sunday.  They had the music cranked and it was packed.  They move through the line quickly.  Got a ham, egg, and cheese on everything bagel.  This thing was awesome.  I cannot wait to go back and try more items.
My favorite bagel shop in the QC! Unique combos, fun atmosphere, quick service. And the bagels are delish. Definitely make sure you come here!

Owen's Bagels is the exact right atmosphere for anyone who likes feeling that they're in a hip lesbian coffee shop from the 90s. I consider this a very high compliment. The space is colorful and warm and the bagel sandwiches are AMAZING. You go, Owen's Bagels.

This place rocks!! 

The owner is awesome you can make ur sandwhich anyway u want and even write down ur own sandwhich creation and add it to there floating menu list!! If ur sandwhich is a hit they will print it on the next menu!

I got the dreadlock but swapped the bacon for tuna.. Yum :-)

Having a neighborhood go-to breakfast/deli is a must and I think this place just be some my go-to.

I have lived in this city for 9 months now and cannot believe it took that long to discover this gem. Owens is tucked away inside the pavilion in south end with somewhat limited parking options. 

The inside is very casually. Writing, scribbles, graffiti, hieroglyphics, and artwork adorns the walls along with stickers, college pendants, and signs with what I imagine to be regular customer's special orders.

The bagels are all fresh daily and the steam the sandwiches. I highly recommend the bialy. They are small but unique, flavorful and delicious.

The menu is humongous...overwhelming really. In addition to that, their are individually created variations mounted above the deli counter. It's usually busy and I always find myself rushing to figure out what I want. My first visit I was hurried into ordering and settled on the Mary's grubby bubbly. It was on the small size because of the bagel, but superb.

On the second visit I had a custom creation of sprouts, bacon, mayo, provolone, lettuce, and avocado on an everything bagel and was equally impressed.

I am so incredibly excited to have found this place and am sure I will be back very soon!

Can't believe this was my first time at Owens! It's been on my bucket list for soo long. I opted to stop in here for a road trip for some carb fuel. I went with the Mary's Grubby Bubby - egg, cheese, avocado, tomato on a biali, which is a skinny bagel baked with caramelized onions. It was delicious, you should definitely not skip this one! Everything you'd want in a bagel sandwich, and extra cheesy!
Friendly & helpful staff. Delicious tasting bagel sandwiches and wraps for meat eaters and non meat eaters alike

I see why this place is a local favorite! 

I stopped in for an early lunch and had the whole place to myself! Whoop! Whoop! 

My first impression was fantastic. Everyone was so friendly! I guess I had a confused look on my face so they asked if it was my first visit, I said yes and they were very excited and made a few suggestions. I took them up on the special of the day. 

On Wednesday's it's "A nice piece of Ash" - love the name...probably because I had fun saying it. 

But I loved the sandwich even more. It has all of my favorites (turkey, cream cheese, veggies and bacon) on an everything bagel. 

My sandwich was ready in no time! And I'll admit that this was my first experience with a steamed bagel. I didn't really know what to expect. Would it be soggy? Would I be able to taste all the flavors I love in my everything bagel? 

Thankfully, it wasn't a soggy mess and I loved how all the flavors blended together! Nice job Owen's...THIS is how you spice up an ordinary turkey bagel sandwich. 

So far it's my favorite. Ok, I know...I haven't tried anything else. I'm a bit bias. But I know if I went again I'd order this without hesitation! So that's always a good thing. I definitely want to try out their breakfast too. 

See you guys very soon!

what an awesome spot. from the super-big menu to the great atmosphere/environment, I was definitely impressed.

It took me a while to check this place out because, being gluten free, I wasn't really sure if there was any options available to me...BUT THERE ARE!

they offer 2 GF bagels, one plain and one everything.

when my boyfriend brought over my bagel, he had told me that the line had actually changed gloves, cutting board, and knife. I didn't have it toasted due to cross contamination but was definitely impressed by the above-and-beyond steps.

disclaimer: we went on a monday around 9 a.m. after flywheel...you now gotta refuel!...and it wasn't very busy. it has been told to me by the boy, that if you arrive past 9 a.m. on weekends, be prepared to wait.

Had to post, obviously, about the best bagels in Charlotte. I have been coming to Owens to enjoy their fresh, steamed delicious bagels since 2004/2005 when they first opened. As bagels are my one food I could eat every day for the rest of my life and never get sick of them, I have high standards. And Owen's has literally never disappointed (except for that time when someone decided to run their car into the building and they were closed for a devastating amount of time. But that's not the bagels' fault). 

ANYWAY I placed my low carb diet on hold yesterday for lunch (to kick off Thanksgiving week, duh) and again- did not disappoint. 

I have been getting Kool Jules as my go-to deli sandwich. For a time, it was off the menu but they would make it for me anyway, and eventually it ended up back on the menu. I like mine with cucumbers instead of sprouts- definitely a good decision. A couple other good ones I've had are the Tonya Harding Club and the BobEQue. My fav breakfast ones are the Sweet Caroline, the Banana Surprise and the traditional Breakfast bagel with sausage egg cheese and cream cheese. 


GO TO OWENS! THEY ARE CHANGING THE WORLD ONE BAGEL AT A TIME!!!

I've heard great things about this place. When my wife and I finally decided to head over and try it, I was surprised. The location is in prime south end, the building itself is very weird.  Some of the menu items sounded awesome ... some a little weirdly delicious, despite the pairings. 

We were just plain-jane's and got sausage, egg + cheese bagels. It's kind of hard to mess that up, so it was good. Nothing earth shattering. I will say, I would give a solid 5 stars to the asiago cheese bagel I had. That thing was outofthisworld. We did have about a bit of a wait for them to make it, so I wouldn't stop in here if you're in a rush to get in+out. It's no McDonald's breakfast. Definitely worth the try, especially if you're feeling randy for same variety.
Good food.  Ran out of the loaded grits today :(  place is pretty busy.  Ate here yesterday and was good so decided to come back today

GREAT place! Bagels are excellent. 

Cool atmosphere but it is too cool...meaning they think it's ok to have you wait for 15 min for a bagel w cream cheese. 

Definitely check this place out though. worth the wait.

I knew I'd be down w Owens from the moment i walked in.. guess u could say the writing was on the wall!

i love their super creative selection of bagel and bialy sandwiches.. their food is very good, but the highly likable atmoshpere and great peeps running the join def sealed the 5th star for me.

I got the 'south end' w turkey, tomato, onion, spinach cream cheese on a bialy. yeah its a good as it sounds.

Had the basic breakfast bagel (sausage, egg and cheese... pepper jack, specifically) and it was ze bomb! Their sausage is an actual one cut thinly into perfection. It doesn't make you question the contents. I will have to keep coming back to try the other gazillion things on the menu- so many options that I had to go basic.

Reading the recent activity on YELP about Owen's, I had to find out for myself.  I went  today and had a bagel and a cup of coffee.  My coffee wasn't hot, it must have been the bottom of the press pot but for some reason, it didn't bother me and they still get 5 stars.  They were really nice, my bagel was served hot and delicious.  Their coffee is Larry's Beans, so Owen's is supporting a NC business, so we should support their NC business!!!  Right?  

Owen's takes pride in their food and it shows, they also serve Boars Head meats and you can go to Leather and Lace and get a lap dance afterwards, now that is full  service..

I will rate Owen's Bagel & Deli four corn dogs.

The original Bagel & Deli is in Oxford, Ohio on the campus of Miami University. The atmosphere isn't quite the same at Owen's as what we had in college, but the sandwiches are just as good. 

I read a few people complaining that the bagels are soft, or that the bagels aren't as good as New York's bagels, or even that it wasn't as good as advertised. But most of the complaints I saw were from people that weren't willing to try any of the signature sandwiches that put Bagel & Deli on the map back at Miami. These bagels aren't supposed to be hard, they are steamed so that everything melts together into a gooey delicious treat. 

For us, this was our late night and hangover food for four (or more) years. I would never have ordered a bacon egg and cheese and think I'm getting McDonald's or even Panera. That's not what it is, so if that's what you're looking for, go elsewhere.

We were looking for a quick bite to eat. Upon entering we grabbed a menu to decide what to eat. I had the nice piece of ash. I had seen it many times on Yelp so I decided to try it. It really is a great sandwich. The bagel is fresh and chewy. If you are from NYC and know anything about H&H bagels, they kind of remind me of those. 

As we sat there, I was intrigued by the writing on the wall. I just sat and read as many as possible. I'd love to come back and try some of their other sandwiches, or even just get one of those bagels with cream cheese.

The iced coffee is self-serve, WITH A WARNING! They have a camera fixed on you so you don't try to get free refills. The coffee was very good, I just wish the creamers were in a canister as opposed to the small individual creamers. I know...not a dealbreaker, just a personal preference.

What's not to love? Tucked inside the Pavilion in Southend, crazy art on the walls, banners, notes written in sharpie, mismatched chairs, rocking chairs, and an odd layout to boot. Needless to say, it's PERFECT. My kind of spot for a good breakfast or any time, for that matter. It's like a Common Market met a grungy record shop and then decided to focus on bagels. I just love this place. 

Parking can feel a bit odd since there aren't many spaces out front and it's so close to South Blvd. I'd park where ever you can find an open space. 

The menu is extensive with tons of crazy concoctions. There are plenty of more breakfast-style choices but tons that will appeal to the lunch bunch as well. My favorite for an anytime or good breakfast -- Mary's Grubby Bubby. Tomato, avocado, egg, and muenster. I was stoked to see they had some bialy left, too! Tried it on for size and it was amazing. I love making bialy at home and Owen's really hit the spot. 

Though I didn't grab a cup of coffee with my breakfast, the roaster they use out of Raleigh had bottles of cold brew in the cooler. Love trying new cold brews and loved that Owen's had this for sale. Picked up a bottle on the way out. 

The service is great. Homeboy was nice and took care of like 6 people after I ordered mine. That guy had some hustle, too. He then came out and took care of the entire room while everyone was eating. One man teams like that are hard to come by. My hat's off to you, my friend. 

Owen's is numero uno if I'm ever in Southend and craving a bagel. Next up, I'm going for something a little heartier! Can't wait to come back again. It had been too long since my first. Thanks, Owen's!

Solid spot with really good bagels. I had sausage egg and cheese sandwich which was really good. Not much of a spot for craft coffee but the cold brew was ok. Overall i would go back, it was in a convenient spot in south end and well priced.
Awesome atmosphere! Awesome unique bagel sandwich. Steamed who would of thought of this?? So good ! Go get you some !

You guys!  This place is a hidden gem. It's never too busy, which is a great thing,  but i hope they're generating enough income to keep in business.  So go!  You can get breakfast for lunch.  It's a good find.
Great bagel sandwiches for great prices.  They have funny names for all of their specials.  The Tanya Harding is yummy.

Owens is the best breakfast sandwich in town. I had been told I needed to check it out but procrastinated for a year. I wish I hadn't. 

The bagels are amazing and there are options for just about anyone. They tend to get busy on a weekend around lunch time but it's worth the wait. 

After a night out, there's nothing better than throwing on some clothes and rolling into Owen's (it's often obvious many others have done the same). 

The bagels and toppings taste fresh with I have found is rare for a bagel/breakfast sandwich place in this area. 

I would recommend possibly going earlier in be morning or later in the afternoon if going on the weekend unless you want to wait. They simply can't handle the amount of people they get at lunch time to make it move any faster (and that is not there fault at all, it's just the sheer number of people ordering).
The best bagels you can find in Charlotte right next to a strip club...need I say more?

Good place for a quick breakfast in South End. However, the bagel was too soft and pork roll was so thin it was pretty much just bacon but this is coming from a New Jerseyan used to her bagels a certain way. The sandwich as a whole was delicious. Ooey gooey and cheesy. The jalapeño cream cheese was amazinggg, best part of the sandwich. My boyfriend got the sundried tomato cream cheese and he said it over powered the rest of the sandwich so maybe only get that if you're just getting a regular bagel. I would go back and recommend that others give it a try!

Just like Pat's steaks... but with bagels... and in Charlotte...

I want to start this out with my favorite part of Owens- their service. I got up here just as they were opening their doors on a Saturday to see a line formed outside. Of course at first I didn't have a good feeling about waiting. Usually when you see a line out the door of any place in the south you better clear your schedule for the rest of the day. But I was told this was pretty normal operation here for a Saturday morning, so I figured I'd stick it out. Thankfully the line moved quick. Once inside and ready to give my order, I was hit with that classic "quick jab" ordering convo that had been keeping the line moving. Love it. So similarly to an order at Pat's, I also limited myself to just three responses- "Mama C. Everything bagel. Regular cc." Paid, and stepped aside. Painless. So painless. And the order was out just as quick as waiting in the line. That, my friends, is how it's done.

As for a VERY close second- their food. These bagels are FRESH and the sandwich combo's are fantastic. You cannot leave here without finding one of their menu items to become your new breakfast addiction. My Mama C- which was lox sandwich on an everything bagel with all the trimmings- was about one of about a dozen others I was on the fence with. (Just means I'll have to be back another eleven times I guess!) And don't think they are only limited to breakfast-type sandwiches either, they definitely have all kinds. 

The atmosphere of this place deceives you into thinking you've strolled into the Noda neighborhood temporarily. 

There can definitely be some limited seating on a Saturday.

I've been coming to Owens since before I actually moved to Charlotte, so I figure a review is long overdue. Owens is my go-to spot for breakfast bagels for their creative menu, delicious sandwiches, and unique vibe.

Walking in for the first time can be a bit intimidating for a few reasons including the long line and expansive menu. I have no idea who put together their original menu, but it's worth a short read for entertainment. If you can't find something that grabs you, then you can't go wrong with making your own. I often lean on bacon, egg, cheddar with avacado. Hangover helper is a solid backup (and yes, it does help). 

I do like that they steam their bagels, which seems to meld the flavors together better than toasting. Be careful though, as the bagels are around 1 million degrees when you first get them. Also be sure to check out their strong coffee game that features local roasters and now cold brew on tap.

For my fellow Jews out there who have been hard pressed on finding a good ol' bagel and lox and some Dr. Browns soda in Charlotte, Owens may just do it for you. Having just moved from Boca Raton, FL, where aside from New York is the land of the Jewish Deli, I've been yearning to find the equivalent here in Charlotte. Not realizing that outside of my Jewish Deli bubble it was going to be very hard to satisfy my craving, I finally stumbled upon Owens and I am blissfully satisfied. 

  I wish i would have asked her name but a very sweet woman told me all about the place after I told her that it was my first time there and so I ordered my onion bagel with lox(nova)cream cheese onion and tomato. I was verrrry happy to finally find a place that resembled something like home.

   It's a very unique looking little place. Hand drawn menus hanging up, that are very funny and writings all over the wall which is pretty darn cool. They have some organic options as well as supporting local vendors which is AWESOME! So if you haven't tried it yet, Just do it!! I will be coming back when I have my bagel and lox cravings (which happens often).

This place is a hidden gem!!

It's located inside a shopping center, and if you blink you just might miss it! I visited today between classes, and the menu made everything sound so great I couldn't decide and ordered two different bagels: the booty bagel and an onion bagel with house-made veggie cream cheese. The shop is an open warehouse type set up; customers are allowed to leave their mark/artwork/name on any wall with space and there is plenty of seating and workspace available.

[The Booty Bagel] Cinnamon raisin bagel with peanut butter, banana and honey; perfection from start to finish. How could this taste bad?
[Onion with Veggie CC] The bagel could have had more onion sprinkled on top, but I say that as a die-hard onion fan. The cream cheese was great! Reminded me of the garden veggie CC at most other bagel shops. 

*I also got a free fountain drink coupon just for checking in on Yelp! so thats always a good deal.

A great little find. Magic bagel sandwiches.

This little deli spot is located inside a space with other businesses and is funky and fresh! They have all these cool bagel sandwiches with names like The Tonya Harding and the Federline!  They do this steaming thing that seems to make the sandwiches magical. I really liked the Southend - yummy little cucumber salad too - lots of seating in a very artsy/picnic style space.

Casual, quick, affordable lunch spot.

I'll start with the good stuff. The bagels were fresh and perfectly chewy, the toppings were plentiful. The cold brew coffee had me buzzing for hours. All wonderful things for a simple brunch. 

The bad - Holy crap, this place is loud! If you want club level music with your brunch, this is the place for you. This was definitely a turn off for me and my husband. Of course, we feel very old for admitting this. 

There was quite a long line when we arrived, but it moves fairly quickly. We definitely waited a long time for our food once the order was in, though.

My original plan was to go to Einstein Bagel.  After circling the parking lot a couple of times and getting a spot snagged from me twice, I remembered seeing a place called Owen's just slightly further down South Blvd.  

There was plenty of parking around back and I was immediately in a better mood.  I absolutely loved the vibe in there (not to mention I was almost lured in to Polished to get my nails and toes DID). 

There was SO much to pick from on the menu and I was borderlining *hangry* so I figured I'd stick to something quick and easy and ordered a ham, egg and cheese and grabbed an OJ.  While waiting for my food (which wasn't long) I walked through the shop reading all of the fun things that customer's have written on the walls. It took me right down memory lane since as a child my Mom allowed my friends and I to use one room in my wall as a drawing board (crazy, right?)

The staff was nice, service quick and once I got home and inhaled my ham, egg and cheese I considered going back for another.  I will definitely be returning soon!
Been coming here for years! It's delicious, and you can't find a steamed bagel anywhere else in Charlotte. Love Owen's!!

My "new" husband and I went to Owen's for brunch the day after our wedding. I absolutely loved my bagel and got a few bites of Joe's that were fantastic as well. I love the location, the staff, the funky decorations, and the music they play in the joint. It is definitely worth giving a try... from this point forward I will drive past the major bagel chain on South Blvd. that I've been known to frequent to support this awesomely delicious local restaurant!

This is one of my favorite breakfast places in all of Charlotte. Owen's has tons of funky bagel combinations and is a great place for breakfast or lunch. The atmosphere is also funky and unique. The only downfall to this place is the wait time. I have been a few times when it was not crowded yet had to wait 15+ minutes for my food.

Also, try the cold brew coffee it's great!

Great place for lunch.  I believe what I had was called smack that ash.  It had ash in the name and it was amazing from the bacon ranch to the soft everything bagel.  The flavors were awesome and the bagel was not dry at all.  I will be going back.  Customer service was awesome as well

If you like bagels, you will LOVE Owen's!  They sell cold brew coffee, too!

Now if only I could remember to make an appointment for a mani/pedi at the nail salon across the hall...

Happiness is a warm bagel.

Owen's claim to fame is their bagel steaming process.  Before I came here, I had no idea what bagel steaming entailed, but it beats the heck out of toasting.  Bagels (and bagel sandwiches) go in the steamer as regular bagels.  A couple minutes later, they come out warm packets of chewey bagel goodness.  I especially recommend it for bagel sandwiches involving cheese. 

I ordered the Italian bagel sandwich -- a combination of ham, pepperoni, provelone and banana peppers on an onion bagel.  I subbed a plain bagel, since I hate onions, and the server was totally cool with the substitution.  After steaming, the bagel came out a cheesey warm chewey delight.  Think toasted Quiznos, but with better ingredients.

The wide range of menu items can be a little overwhelming if you're looking at the variety of posters suspended from the ceiling.  Your better bet is to grab a printed menu from the counter.

Perhaps the only thing better than a steamed bagel from this shop is a steamed cookie.  The cookies are generously sized and delicious as-is.  But if you can talk your server into popping a cookie into the steamer, it comes out chewey and melty like it was fresh from the oven.

Owen's bagel shop might be a little tough to find, but the bagels make it worth seeking out.

The weekend lines are long (and filled with some serious walk of shame outfits) but it's worth it - the bagel sandwiches are phenomenal. I change my order in my mind about 5 times while in line - all options are great

Great tucked away bagel place. Huge menu, but well categorized so you can find what you'd like quickly.

Friendly Staff, Fun Atmosphere. 

Highly recommended if you are in the mood for a bagel. 

Hidden parking around back if you can't find a spot upfront.

Owen's bagel is solid.  Great coffee ( pure intentions ), great assortment of bagel sandwiches, and a decent price.  Everything came out quick and awesome.  Be prepared to listen for your number when they call it out or they will remind you what you ordered and that they don't have time for your bs ( i love this ).  What drops this place down is the steamed bagel.  I hate and love it at the same time.  The bagels look amazing and with steaming it makes them softer and a good choice for sandwiches.  The problem is I love bagels and it makes the bagels taste a little meh.  I def will be back as its a good spot to grab breakfast/brunch.

First time trying and HOLY SMOKES is it good! I have been dying to try this place after hearing they had gluten free bagels! Got the basic bacon egg and cheese on a GF everything bagel. It was hot and made to order! Wishing I had gotten another (or two). Will definitely be back!

Really amazing bagels! NICE PIECE OF ASH is SOOOO GOOD!!! ¡Muy delicioso!
The music can be a little overwhelming, but fits the joint. The staff is always very nice and willing to recommend bagels!
Probably my favorite bagel joint in the CLT!!!
Good eats and good peeps! The Reuben was awesome and the service was great. Better than the big chain bagel places for sure!

Nice stop, funky interior. Takes a while to get a bagel, but that's the care going into making it that takes so long, right? They have an overwhelming menu, but it's a good thing...it all looks great! I've had a few bagel sandwiches and they've been really good and totally filling. 

They just partnered with Foodie Call so you can get a bagel wherever you are in the Queen City! 

There is free WiFi, a patio that gets direct sunlight (get a tan while you eat!), and plenty of seating indoors. Parking space is limited, so on a busy day plan to park on a neighborhood street and have a nice walk.

This place has some amazing looking and yummy bagel sandwiches. Our group had the Phish bagel, salmon bagel, and a chocolate one. They were all very good and I will definitely be back again for them. The coffee was not good however but they make up for it with the bagels.

Hot damn, this was the best bagel sandwich I've ever had. 

So I used to work at Bruegger's as a teen, and those are some good bagels: boiled up then baked for a crunchy outside and a nice chewy center. (I know it's a regional debate, but this is how bagels should be.)  I've eaten every kind of sandwich there is; my favorite is roast beef with jalapeno cream cheese loaded up with veggies, on a warm Everything bagel. 

I digress. My point is, I now have a new favorite: I got the Hangover (Ham, Egg & Smoked Cheddar) on an Everything bagel. Wow. I wanted everything on the menu (check it out, it's huge) but I had to pick one.

So they steam the bagels after the sandwich is all put together. Or maybe before? Who knows. What I do know is that it makes the bagel slightly soft. Now, I wouldn't think I would be into that, but as it turns out I LOVE IT. A regular bagel, even when freshly baked, has a stiffness to it that when you bite into it, causes all the fillings to smoosh and shoot out the other side (which means you have to eat it like a taco and keep taking bites from different ends). This is not the case with a steamed bagel sandwich! The bagel is just soft enough to give so that everything stays in place resulting in a PERFECT PROPORTION OF BAGEL TO FILLING. Genius.

So I don't live in Charlotte, sh*t!! Wanna franchise in Austin!? For now, I'll have to make a point to stop by every single time I visit. (By marrying my boyfriend I've guaranteed this can occur at least once a year. Yup, that was in the PRO column when I decided to marry him. Granted he did ask me only a few hours after we ate at Owen's. In fact, he later told me, when we were in line, he asked the Magic 8 Ball on the counter if he should pop the question. The answer: "Without a doubt." Thanks, Owen's Magic 8 Ball :-)

My point? Go there. Get your bagel on. 

Oh, the staff is friendly, it's reasonably priced (if not cheap!!) and the  place is super  cute. Bring a Sharpie so you can leave your mark!

Hey.  You.  Owen's is terrible.  Don't go there.








Not buying it, huh?  Well... I guess we couldn't keep it a secret forever. Owen's is hands down the best specialty bagel sandwich shop in Charlotte.  Listen, that's a big statement from me.  My family has been in the bagel business for over 50 years.  We owned one of the first bagel shops in New York and LA before Brueggar's and Einstein's came in and demolished everyone.  You want a good bagel in Charlotte?  Owen's or Poppy's.  That's it.

All you need to know is if you can dream it, Owen's can do it.

Fan Favorites:
* Grubby Bubby
* Booty Bagel on Blueberry

Personal Favorite:
* Bagel, Egg and Chive Cream Cheese (add salt and pepper) on Everything.

Other Important Notes:
Dogs are welcome, but not preferred inside the actual bagel shop.  You can write on the walls.  If you're going with two people, best to each get your own sandwhich and then share a Booty Bagel for dessert (Yes, I most certainly believe in breakfast dessert).

My only wish is that they had better coffee.  But for how good the bagels are, I'll drink it.

Cheers to the fat kids!
Mama C's Lox are always a wonderful way to start the day. The staff is pleasant and quick even when there is a line out the door.
Their bagels sandwiches are SO good! A bit pricey though.

3 years ago I would have given Owen's 4, maybe even 5 stars.  These days I can only give it 2.  One reason is the young kids they have working in there who talk and text on their phones and than proceed to make sandwiches without washing their hands. Cell phones are dirtier than toilets.  Another reason is the price.  Most bagels are over $5 and they are not worth the price - with combos costing about $7.  I can get a good sized fresh made sub from Jersey Mike's, with chips and a drink for that price.  Sure the interior is funky and it's local and all of that stuff, but when products are overpriced and service isn't so good, I'd rather go somewhere else and get my moeny's worth.

Nice people, but very disorganized. The layout doesn't make sense. You get coffee, you go to the right, but you get food you go to the left.

They call out long numbers for your order and don't confirm what's it is. I got my sandwich and it was wrong. I had like 3 things and they don't give you a bag, so it was awkward carrying everything out.

It was a very discombobulated experience.

Have been going to Owen's for several years now and it is always a reliable bet. Mary's Grubby Bubby is my personal favorite. They used to have a lot of fun signs for the different bagel sandwiches, but those seem to have been consolidated to a different wall now. 

They've improved their ordering system over the years which makes it a whole lot easier to hear when your order is called (# rather than type of sandwich). The service is a little rough around the edges and seating is a bit sparse with the weekend hordes of 20-somethings coming in looking like they just finished yoga and/or a marathon. 

Will continue to keep coming here on occasion to support local business and decent quality food.

Woo! Best bagels in Charlotte hands down. So soft and delicious. I love the mix of bagel sandwiches they have, especially the vegetarian options. However, the classic egg, sausage and cheese is bomb and always a great pick. I recommend getting the everything or asiago bagel if you're getting a sandwich -Trust me.  

They also have a BYO option so if you don't find anything you like you can always do that. Plus, if you check-in you get a free soda. 

There is usually a line here, especially on the weekends, but they are pretty fast and the bagel is worth it.

This place is home of the steamed bagel.  All the bagels are steamed and wrapped in tin foil like a burrito (which is the easiest way to eat them).  The menu is full of delighful combinations, one of my favorite is the Sweet Thursday- cinnamon raisin bagel, egg, swiss cheese, and tomato, I know it sounds wierd but it's delicious.  The chicken salad is also pretty good.  The sandwiches are large but they aren't cheap- look for the special of the day.

Boyfriend and I love this place. I'm vegan and he is a omnivore and we both leave happy... Awesome service every time. For vegans they have a ton of vegetables and vegan cream cheese!

Keywords: vegan breakfast, vegan lunch, vegan bagels, vegan brunch

I really like Owen's and their food is always good, but the location and line always get me. They have a large selection and you can pretty much build any kind of bagel sandwich you want. The location is in a building where different businesses rent out spaces, but it's across the way from a nail salon so you get whiffs of the chemicals while you're eating. Yum. If you go during prime hours, be prepared for a line out the door and a wait. I don't go out of my way to go here, but I do like it when I'm in the Southend area.
Breakfast in bed bagel? Enough said, go get IT! Sweetness with a mix of southern breakfast taste all-in-one.
Food was pretty good. Nice to have a local bagel shop. A lotylr expensive but good quality food.

If you're going to get a bagel, seek no further. After being introduced a few months ago to Owen's Bagels, I've been an avid repeat customer. It has a relaxed vibe, with graffiti all over the brightly colored walls, and "thank you" notes from locals schools.
I love the menu. It offers a huge variety from vegetarian to crazy bagel breakfast sandwich options. Coming from NYC, I sought out a good bagelry for those Sunday or hangover mornings and I need to seek no further. Try the Lottery Bagel...it's the staff's choice combination of a sandwich. I guarantee you'll never be disappointed.

Most importantly the bagels are great. Shared the Mamas Lox and the Booty Bagel and enjoyed both. The only reason I am giving this place three instead of four stars is because the weekend morning crowd is clearly huge. Please push those tables in the waiting area to the side or remove them until post rush. It would not be difficult, and it would really help with maneuvering space as you are waiting. And mics would help to hear over the (great!) music. Again. Food is great. And that's really the most important part. But space during busy times would help the overall experience.

The bagels are good, however, they're not the best I've ever had. My sister's order came out missing two of the ingredients, the cheese and the avocado. The staff here is honestly the best though, which is a big reason for the four stars. Friendly, helpful, and genuine people who care about their customers!! I walked in and immediately felt welcomed with their hearty greetings and smiles. Great vibes and decor!

Yesterday before work I ran by Owens to get a bagel. They are one of the few bagel places I know of that carry vegan cream cheese so when I get a craving its nice to have them down the block from where I work. 

Unfortunately yesterday there was a mix up and they put veggie cream cheese (real cream cheese with veggie bits mixed in) on my bagel instead. I didn't notice until I got to work and opened up my bagel. Luckily a co-worker brought some cereal and I traded her my bagel. But still, bummer, plain cereal was far from the toasted bagel I wanted.

So today I went back before work because I was still craving that bagel. It was the same man at the register from yesterday and I politely asked to make sure it was vegan and not veggie. He recognized me and apologized and took care of the cost for my bagel today. As I waited I watched him go over and tell the cook to make sure the correct spread was on my bagel. Everyone was very friendly and eager to correct the mistake from yesterday. 

I wasn't expecting all they did. I work in the hospitality industry and I understand mix ups happen. I wasn't upset with them by any means and they still did everything they could to rectify the situation.
Everyone who works here is super friendly - there are so many options for carnivores, vegetarians, vegans + now even gf bagels! Definitely our go-to quick breakfast spot!

This place is unbelievable...it is SO GOOD!!! The bagels are so fresh and can be steamed/toasted. The eggs are always so fresh as well as the meat. The avocado is always GREEN too, that is important. The staff is friendly and the service is quick. I always have a good experience here so matter what I order. Tons of options for every style eater!

Love everything about this little Deli!!! They have a huge variety of sandwiches and NY Style Bagels...which is the absolute best!! You can mix and match, add, subtract whatever you want and it's all approved with a smile. The staff is great, the decor is so damn artsy you'll love the vibe. My one disappointment is that they close super early (3) but hey they are always busy so I can imagine they need the rest

This is my fav bagel/weekend stop!! I used to live uptown/dilworth and just moved to Cary, NC. Everytime, I am back in the area---Owen's is a must. I love that they customize the sandwiches and it's just amazing every time. 
I love that they're so spunky and eclectic ...definitely a Charlotte staple.

First time here, and I didn't know what I wanted.  So I went with their Lottery Bagel, where they make one at random for you.  Chips and drink included for $7.50.

Listen, if I can get a random bagel sandwich and it turns out to be the best bagel sandwich I've ever had, that probably means I need to eat more bagel sandwiches.

But hey, you've gotta give credit where it's due.  This place is awesome.  I'll definitely be back for more bagel sandwiches.
Gotta get your bagel double steamed. Trust me. If the pimento cheese grits are still a special they are a must.

Went in today for the first time and I will say, my bagel was awesome. Mary Grubby Bubby: egg, cheese, tomato, avocado. YUM. SO YUM! Great breakfast/quick lunch. Service is whatever but what can can you expect from a cashier and a couple of people behind of a grill. I totally understand that with the vibe of the place it's not expected or necessary to have 100% over the top service. Anyway... I will go again soon and try another bagel and I'm very excited!

Try number two - I got a message from Ashley, the owner, after my first review asking me to please give them another shot. I came in last week, weekday morning and they were dead. It was probably about 7:30am? When I walked in, the lady behind the desk was on her phone, but she greeted me. It took me a while to figure out what I wanted, but she was patient and kept checking in on me to see if I was ready. I eventually made a build your own - I told you in the last review that I'm a little bit of a bagel and egg snob. I asked for a *toasted* not steamed bagel, with bacon, egg whites, cheese and avocado. She didn't say much until she gave me my bagel - then she told me that it was going to be a good sandwich and called me honey. A glimmer of friendliness! Yay! The sandwich was good, she was right. Unfortunately, with my bagel, bottle of water and coffee the total was over $10. But it was good food. Avocado seemed fresh, egg whites were good. I'll probably be back for a bagel, but I'll have to figure out what I like on the menu. Maybe eventually I'll get into the steamed thing? Yelpers, maybe we could all go and get some bagels. :)

Well I finally got to try Owen's yesterday and I have to say it was pretty good. I'm usually in this area whenever I go to the dentist or get my hair done and failed to realize how close it was to both of those places for me!! Owen's is tucked away in the same strip as the Polished nail salon - right across the street from Atherton. All this time and I never paid attention!

I got to Owen's around 9:45 on a Saturday morning and was expecting to be met with a long line but thankfully it was not the case. I placed my order for a standard bacon & egg (no cheese please!) on an everything, a plain bagel (not toasted, only sliced), and coffee. For those three items, my total came to $9.36 which I found slightly ridiculous but whatevs. For the price, I didn't like the fact that there's only two coffee choices - decaf or regular. No flavored coffees to choose from but there's a slew of flavored creamers and half and half cups and sugars.

Once you place your order, you move over to the side to wait until your number is called out. Even though there was a good amount of people working behind the counter and not too busy, myself and others still had to wait a bit for our orders to be called. As I waited, I saw that they started to get busier and the line to place an order was getting longer. Once my number was called, I was very hungry and eager to jump right into my sandwich. I could feel the heat from the sandwich through the bag. And that sucker was HOT! like fresh out of the steamer hot. The bagel was nice and chewy but the everything bagel flavor was very underwhelming.

I'm looking forward to going back and trying one of their signature sandwich creations just so I can really get a taste of an authentic Owen's bagel sandwich experience.

One of our favorite places for breakfast or lunch in SouthEnd. Their bagel sandwiches are excellent and the bagels themselves are very soft, just the right texture. Lots of different combinations of sandwiches. I get the hangover helper with egg, cheese, and ham with a drink for $6. The place has a funky vibe to it and there are only a handful of tables but it is never packed. Only thing keeping it from 5* is that the bagel sandwiches range from $6-$8 without a side or drink so it is a little pricey for what you get. But the taste is great!

Cashier was hard of hearing.  Wife asked for egg fried hard twice and got a runny yolk which she cannot eat (texture is a major put off) but she stomached anyway.  Asked if the pimento cheese grits came as a side and the cashier just looked at her.  Perhaps they should turn the music down?  My pizza bagel is listed on the menu on an onion bagel, but came out plain (not requested).  Sauce was plain tomato paste with no seasoning and cold pepperoni.  Overall food was over-priced, particularly given the service and quality.  Would not eat there again.

Very unique variety of food! I got a bagel sandwich that has Doritos on it and it was awesome to be able to try something new and unique that was extremely tasty. This place is so great that there's is often a wait but they move quickly and efficiently. Great value for the price you pay!
Amazing warm and fresh bagels and fantastic front line service crew! Way to go Owen's Bagel & Deli!!
Bagels are well steamed and ingredients of the sandwiches tasty, but in the middle of June, what's up with these translucent tomatoes?  Isn't there a farmer's market across the street?

I love Owens and I'm so pumped that they have reopened!
