Great for either breakfast or lunch, this place has got delicious bagels that can be prepared by toasting or steaming them and unbelievable coffee. My standard- a steamed blueberry bagel with cream cheese and a coffee = heavenly mornings. Set up your laptop to power through some work or set up a meeting here! It's the perfect meet up place that's centrally located in South End!
It was crowded. But man, the vibe here is great. Awesome funky bagel styles. Cool little artsy visual menu. Cool interior and great staff.

I went here for the first time yesterday and I will definitely be back.  I had the Mary's Grubby Bubby and it was awesome...melty cheese, avocado, egg, yum!  Better than the food is the service.  I had gotten the wrong bagel and got home to realize that I had...I went back and the owner herself (Ashley) refunded my money and got me the correct sandwich in no time!  If you're a sucker for hot bagel sandwiches, you must try it.  You won't be disappointed!

This is one of my favorite breakfast and weekend lunch places in Charlotte.
If you haven't been before, it is is a little hard to find as it is in the interior of a tiny little strip mall.
They have a delicious array of bagels as is. But what they do with those bagels makes this place noteworthy. It is not a unique concept but they seem to be the only place in Charlotte that has really taken bagel sandwiches to the next level.
Offering about 50 bagel sandwich varieties plus the ability to make custom sandwiches or just have a bagel with cream cheese, there is definitely something for everyone here.
You can get everything from a sausage egg and cheese bagel to a post workout peanut butter and banana sandwich to one piled high with turkey, avocado, sprouts, and cheese. They even have one to help with your hangover. ;-)
While prices start at just over $2, plan on spending $4-6 for a bagel sandwich and even more if you want chips and fountain drink or coffee. But, you will always leave content and looking forward to your next visit, ready to try a different delicious combination.
The atmosphere is great and the bagels are even better. I always get the Grubby Bubby. There are lots of options for vegetarians and meat-eaters alike.

I really, really want to like this place. Super nice staff, kid friendly, but the steamed bagel sandwiches are just so blah. I have been twice for lunch and this week I brought my husband a sandwich. Three different menu items and the same response for each ... eh.  I will come back with my kiddos but I think I will stick with the basic bagels and cream cheese.

Super cool spot in a small, mixed-use facility just outside downtown Charlotte - Uptown, as I've been told. The place has a young, "college-y" feel with things hanging and written all over the walls and tasteful rap music thumping - almost like a club. It also reminded me of my CookOut days while back at uni. Once you've put your order in at the fro t counter you kind of stand/sit around until your number is called.

**caveat: this place may be fast-casual in food order/delivery and have a young/college ethos BUT it is extremely tasty and there were a few families with their babies present. Just saying.

The menu is extensive with plenty of bagel types to choose from with several main/meat ingredients: tuna and Chx salad; turkey; pizza; corned and roast beef; bacon; egg; veggie; etc. Add ons like assorted cheeses and cream cheeses; guacamole; basil; peppers; tomato; pizza sauce; etc. 

They offered for a if their own renditions with all kinds of different combinations or you could build your own w $1.75 bagel and $0.50-$1.00/ topping. On top of being beyond reasonably priced it was super tasty!

I was one human being in a party of four and the Owen's Bagels team happens to let one order slip through the cracks.. after she waited ~25 minutes I approached the counter w the issue. At the end of the day they more than took care of us and made it right.

TL;DR. If you are in Charlotte and don't at least brunch here once, you're doing yourself a huge disservice. This spot is AWESOME! Indoor seating only.

Until next time..

CHEERS!!!

Owens it just so ridiculously good. It's my weekly indulgence , bacon egg & cheddar on wheat. If I don't have it, I can feel the shakes start. Everyone who works there- including the owner- are so friendly and always take a few minutes to say hello and check in. I love owens !!

Best bagel in Charlotte!! Quirky place good bagels. I'm from Dallas and just moved here looking for a good bagel place. I have finally found it. My family and I got all different types of bagels and everyone loved what they got. They recommend you get them steamed and I agree!

On mornings when I'm struggling from the night before or when I need to fuel up for a big day ahead, I'm all about Owen's. 

Some people (you know who you are) go for the really inventive sandwiches with crazy names like Nice Piece of Ash. I, however, get a whole wheat bagel with sausage, egg and pepper jack cheese. Simple but just perfect. 

Also, get the cheese grits. Just do it. 

Make sure you listen for your exact order when it's busy. There's nothing worse than getting home and realizing some dude swiped your bagel.

I think Owens is probably my favorite bagel place in Charlotte.  I had read the positive reviews for weeks before I actually tried the place out.  I'm a huge bagel fan, but had only had them toasted.  A steamed bagel sounded gross to me.  But, I finally tried it and instantly became a big fan.  It has now become my go-to breakfast place. With that being said, despite what a previous reviewer said, they do have a toaster and will toast your bagel, but I would challenge you to try it steamed.  Very good and a different atmosphere than your chain bagel shops.  The snicker doodle coffee is also delicious (even though they don't have it all the time).

Owen's bagels is by far one of my favorite spots in Charlotte. It was the first place I came to when I moved and I still go there about once a week.  It's a favorite spot of my triathlon team and we go there after practices to refuel.  Love the South End Special.  If you like places that feel unique-- that you can't find in every city--then check out Owen's.  Definitely a staple of Charlotte!

These delicious steamed bagel sandwiches are, for some reason, great post-exhausting-activity food. And by exhausting activity I mean grueling day of sports or night of drinking, pretty much the same thing.

The choices you have in filling your bagel can be overwhelming, just take a breath, close your eyes, and point to somewhere on the menu. Chances are, it'll be delicious. I typically just get my bagel with egg and cheese..hot melted cheese. *drool*

Decor is eclectic and amusing (there's a UCI Anteater flag hanging by the college flags, random!) and staff is friendly.

Parking in front or behind the building, and bathrooms are down the hall to the left. 

Future reference: Honorary last stop of light rail bar crawl, they have great hangover helpers.

Highly recommend riding your bike or walking here so you don't suffer a heart attack on the way home. Amazing, messy, DELICIOUS bagel sammies. 

Make sure you look around the interior before ordering so you can find the special items. Some are on the wall, some are on small table top signs etc.

4.5 stars!  This was one of my favorite places to eat.  Owen's Bagels & Deli is known for their "Steamed" bagels.  

My manager and I stopped in for breakfast.  I ordered the "Mary's Grubby Bubby" - which consist of egg, cheese, avocado, and tomato on a Bialy.  DELICIOUS!

Went here today after hearing it was great for kids and I can say I'm a new fan.  I usually prefer my bagels toasted, not steamed, but their selection of sandwiches was huge and extensive, and mine won me over to the steam-team.
Awesome atmosphere, great music and the writing everyone makes you feel welcome. Even though they closed at 2 on July 4th they still made a bagel after 2. First visit and definitely not the last.

Owen's is a gem. I've often contemplated moving to South End only to be close to Owen's. 

There are tons of choices, but you can't go wrong with the Tonya Harding Club, the Southend Special or the Grubby Bubby. 

Plus, iced coffee on tap! 

Get your bagel steamed.

We visited Owen's Bagel & Deli for lunch on a Friday and it was quick and hit the spot! We had a bacon, egg, and cheese bagel and a pimento BLT bagel. The sandwich was good, but the bagel was great! Would highly recommend this place as a quick brunch or lunch spot. Plenty of places to sit and enjoy

It's so delightful to get a real New York bagel in Charlotte. I grew up eating the real thing and these do not dissapoint. The Mama C's Lox is out of this world!  Sunday mornings are busy but the orders come out very quickly.  I am pretty sure I could eat there every day and never tire of it. :)

Everything was delicious and I will definitely go back! Did not give 5/5 because the specialty bagel prices were a bit much in my opinion (~$6-$8) and no visible Charlotte 49ers flag or pennant that I could see. Disappointing since seemingly almost every other NC university had a small piece of real estate in their shop except for the nearly 30,000 students & 80,000 living alumni (in the Charlotte area at that) university less than 15 minutes away.

Hands down, Owen's is my favorite bagel place in Charlotte. I always get sausage, egg, and cheese on an everything bagel. 3 words- TO DIE FOR. However, my friends do get the fun unique bagel sandwiches and love them! SO GOOD.

The wait was long on a Sunday around lunch time, but well worth it! My first time visiting and I'll definitely be back. Prices are reasonable and the bagel was delicious. Their hummus is made in house and was a great compliment to the one with all veggies.
If I could eat the Tonya Harding club everyday of my life I would die a fat happy happy girl. Hidden gem, truly addictive

Mary's grubby bubby.... Need I say more? It's amazing!!!! 
The bagel is delicious then add some egg, cheese, avocado and tomato oh my it's soooo good. 
My boyfriend adds turkey for extra protein to the grubby and loves it. 
The place is always hopping, so call ahead if you are in a hurry.

It's the only thing We have ever had here, I'm
Boring and when I find something I love I stick to it. So I don't have any other recommendations for ya. But get your heinie over to Owens if you want New York style bagels in the south.

I've been to Owen's Bagels & Deli twice and have really enjoyed both experiences.  The place is no frills, write on the walls and at the end of a small plaza in the South End neighborhood.
 
The bagel sandwiches that I've had were really good.  The staff is friendly and make the sandwiches delivered promptly.  I enjoyed the coffee that is brewed there too.  The sandwiches are larger than the bagels.  I'd like to see the bagels be larger but I'm happy with my experiences.

I'll definitely be back to Owen's.

Bagel lovers looking for a little something old and a little something new wrapped in an original one of a kind shop need to make Owen's a must-try.  

The basic concept here is bagel sammies which have been steamed into submission.  Is it a little messy?  HELLZ YEAH.  But is it tasty?  Ridiculously so.  When the same-ole' won't cut it for my rise and shine, Owen's can awaken my taste buds.

For you purists, if you just want your round dough with just a schemer of something tasty, or if you like your bagel plain or just toasted, they can do that too.  You just have to ask at the time you order and you just have to know that your combo won't have a cool name posted on the hanging menus.  So kids, once and for all, YES they have a toaster and YES they will toast any sandwich or plain bagel.  Huzzah for customization!

Veggie friends, there are many options here.  Vegan friends, there's love for you too: who knew sprouts, avocado, tomato and hummus could get steamed and turned into such a tasty treat?!  Or how about banana, peanut butter, and local honey (assuming you're OK with honey)?  Gooey fun says me.

I also have to give major props to the locally roasted coffee served here.  Larry's Beans makes small batches and they make some pretty wicked flavors and blends.  The Ethiopian blend was nice but the Southern Pecan was so good it really did need any sweetener.  I walked out with a serious case of the jitters, but it was worth it.

Can't decide which to pick?  In my couple trips here the servers called out the "Grubby Bubby" at a ration of about 5:1.  Egg, Muenster, Smoked Cheddar, Avocado and Tomato on a Bialy.  Try picking that up at your local chain bagel shop.  Rock on Owen's crew.

Owens saved my life. I had a critical hangover and the Asiago bagel with bacon ranch cream cheese brought me out of the dark. Bagels imported from NY and housemade cream cheese...doesn't get better. Eat local, try Owens!
Absolutely delicious! This place has never failed me! I picked up an Asiago Bagel with eggs & pepper jack cheese this morning! So flavorful!

Yep...  A Groupon brought my girlfriend and me to Owens Bagels for the first time and we were bemused to see a funky interior and funny sounding sandwiches... I had the very delicious Pigs 'n' the Mud and she tried the Dilworthian... we thoroughly enjoyed the sandwiches but were dismayed by the lukewarm, weak coffee... yuck!  The interior appears clean but there were lots of crumbs on the table edges and floor... we aren't clean freaks but they need more staffing to assist with keeping things cleaner and the coffee made hotter/better...

All in all, we'll be back but hoping for improvement...

Easily the best bagels in Charlotte, and I'm from New Jersey, so I don't kid around about that kind of thing. It's not your traditional New York bagel, but it's steamed it tastes amazing. You can do the traditional bagel and cream cheese (wouldn't recommend steaming these unless you like a gooey cream cheese mess), but my recommendation is the sandwiches. My favorite is the grubby bubby. These sandwiches are so good and gone in two seconds.. I finish one and it takes all my willpower not to get back in line. The staff is friendly, the atmosphere is funky and creative, and the food is out of this world. Also, they carry pork roll... so Jersey friends, get to it!

Great bagels, decent price, many options to pick from.  Friendly cashiers.  All around a great place for a fast bike but, loose the fast part.  This place will take no less than 30 minutes to get your food so come on an off time or be ready to wait.

Meh.
Bagels are steamed therefore, mushy...reminded me of eating play-do.  You'd think they would toast for those who want toasting.  However, it fails me how many businesses prefer to not make money.
Won't be back....sorry, and I so wanted to like this place bc of yelpers and it was local.
Cream cheese spread (spinach) lacked adequate amount of spinach...i mean, come on, if it is called spinach...use some spinach, not just bits of it.

Local bagel shop located just off South Blvd, this place really delivers. Fresh steamed bagels with just about every combination of ingredients you could possibly imagine. My favorite is the Mary's grubby bubby (egg, tomato and avocado) but the hangover helper or classic egg, sausage and cheese taste good on anything. Fresh local coffee is also available self-serve style. Decor inside is pretty neat and unique. Bring a sharpie (or borrow one) if you'd like to add your own personal touch.

Can get really packed later in the mornings, especially on weekends. Parking is available behind the building via a gravel lot. Owen's is on the left when you walk in the building from the lot.

Hands down the best bagel sandwich I've ever had! I never knew such a thing as a steamed bagel even existed till I ate one from here. I tend to steer clear of bagels due to how hard and tough they are, but these were amazing! I got the egg, cheese and avocado bagel and it was fantastic! My friend picked it up so I didn't go inside but from what I hear the ambiance is really cool. The menu seems really extensive but I just went with what I would normally get. Can't wait to go back and try different ones!

Great tasting Bagels In South End. Lots of Variety to choose from. My order was initially mixed up with someone else's but the problem was quickly resolved by the Manager. Will return for future visits!
Love me some Momma C's Lox on a pumpernickel bagel with Jalepeno cream cheese! Add some cheerwine and loaded potato salad and you have yourself a feast!
Grabbed a bagel sammie for breakfast and loved it!! So excited to finally have a great bagel place!

Mary's Grubby Bubby. OMG! Been lusting for it ever since I had it a week or so ago. Nice joint. Pleasant employees. Quick service. Parking's a little tricky. I'm going back to get another Grubby Bubby!!

I really wish that I could make this my go to bagel shop...but as the saying goes, 3 strikes and you're out. Prior to todays visit I would give Owens a solid 3 stars. They're Bagels are nothing to rave about...but they do have a pretty funky/unique space and they do offer tons of sandwich options. Personally, I don't really care for all these crazy sandwich combinations. I just want a GOOD bagel with some cream cheese...maybe an egg sandwich. I'm pretty sure if you take two pieces of card board, load it up with the grubby bubby or booty bagel options, or add avocado, tomato. etc - it's going to be tasty. If that's what people are into, that's cool. I'm more about the actual bagel, ya know? 

I've been eating Bagels all my life up in NY and I can honestly say that I was spoiled with the amount of great options that I had up there. And yes I get it, this is Charlotte -- Not NY. Now I'm not a professional, but I'm pretty sure this place skips out on one crucial step of the bagel making process - the poaching step. I do understand that boiling equipment is super expensive and also takes up lots of space. I'm pretty sure that they just brush their bagels with some water and a little baking soda (similar to what you would do with a soft pretzel) and then hit them with steam once they're in the oven. It's easy to identify an imposter by looking at the bottom of the bagel since steam wont get to the bottom of the bagel once its on a pan or in the oven.  

LESSON OF THE DAY: If the bottom is much harder and darker than the rest of the bagel, you're eating a roll with a hole, not a bagel my friend! The bagels here almost remind me of one of those Thomas' bagels from the super market. But anyways, enough about the bagels.

Today's experience brought them down to a 2 star rating - I ordered a bacon egg & cheese (with salt, pepper, ketchup) to go and I got a small coffee - My bill was  $8.39. The word "pricey" doesn't usually come out of my mouth....but I walked out of the store thinking to myself..."dear god, did I just pay almost $9 for a bagel & small coffee?"

I get to my office, sit down and go to enjoy my sandwich, which for that price should have been wrapped in gold foil. Slowly, disappointment began sinking in 
(insert worlds saddest song on worlds smallest violin here**)

1) My sandwich was pretty small - hey, it is what it is. I wouldn't complain about it being small if it at least tasted delicious and the order didn't get screwed up. 2) The eggs reminded me of dunkin donut egg sandwiches - you know, those premade egg patties that get nuked in the microwave. 3) Lastly, they left out the salt, pepper & ketchup!!! The SPP is crucial on my egg sandwiches! 

BEC with salt, pepper, ketchup...doesn't seem like a difficult order. Anyways,I'm happy that most people on here have had a great experiences here... I wish I could feel the same way. 

Long story LONGGGGG, It's safe to say that I won't be coming back to Owens. As I mentioned earlier, I really wish I could make my go to spot since they are around the corner from where I live...but it does look like I'll have to take a 10min drive elsewhere when I'm in the mood for bagels -- (wont name drop other businesses as I don't like to do that).
Their bagels are the best. Definitely worth the wait on a Saturday or Sunday morning. Parking is a pain though so if you are close enough I recommend walking.

Loved this place! It's actually inside a larger building that had other things in it like a nail salon but it was still super easy to find. Parking was not a hassle which as always is a plus for me. I loved the decor. There was graffiti all over the walls which sort of reminded me of back home in NYC. There were plenty of tables as well. Then again I did go pretty early. The staff was extremely courteous as it was my first time there. I opted for the Sweet Caroline bagel. Basically a blueberry bagel with cinnamon sugar and cream cheese. It was SO GOOD! I wished it was bigger tho. I've never seen coffee on tap but the cold brew was on tap. I tried to get a video of me working the machine but i deleted it by mistake. I'm not the smartest sometimes. Anyway the coffee was self serve so I poured as much creamer and sugar in as I could lol. The price for both was decent. About $7 for both the bagel and the coffee. I'd definitely go back to try some of the other variations just based off of this experience. Good Stuff!

This is one of my favorite breakfast/brunch/lunch spots to eat and work. I've never been disappointed by the steamed bagel with cream cheese and loaded pimento cheese grits. I mean, yum! The music is perfect, it's a great variety and it's fun to watch the other patrons dance or read the walls when I hit a brain fart. I literally spend at least three hours there working, eating and drinking the locally roasted coffee.

Owen's Bagel & Deli is located in "The Pavilion @ South End" shopping center, in the South End district of Charlotte. The retail center is oddly designed, with multiple vacancies at the moment. 

I thought that the bagels were made on the premises, but a sign at the door announced that the bagels served were actually from New York. Curious about the steamed heating method, I did not allow the sign to deter me from entering, although I was a little concerned about another sign taped to the door where the resto apologized for the "inconsistency" of the bagels. 

The bagel shop itself looked more like a university dining commons room gone wild, with school banners all about and graffiti over every inch of the walls. As I waited for my order, a simple onion bagel with cream cheese and a breakfast bagel, I spied a poster that read "War is unsafe for children and living things".  A rather smart thought, however, on each table was a table tent advertising that they were switching back to styrofoam cups, since patrons did not like the plastic ones. Styrofoam? Does that not hurt living things as well, sitting in landfill, since styrofoam does not decompose? A bit of a contradiction I thought. 

A few moments later my order came out and as others commented, the bagel heating process makes the bread chewy, however, I didn't mind, since I was prepared for that. If I wanted a traditional bagel, I would have stopped by the bagel shop a few blocks down the street, however, since this cooking method appeared to be a local thing, I had to try it out. 

Overall, nice staff, reasonable prices and interesting decor. The heating method itself, well ... interesting.

I had Mary's Grubby bubby and added turkey sausage which was great! Will definitely be back when we are in the area. Only downside the wait is a bit took a decent amount for 2 sandwiches to come out. Food was excellent tho!

First thing I noticed when I walked into this place: Owen's Bagel & Deli is definitely a popular spot for the hung over kids in Southend.

As long as I'm grabbin' and goin', I'm a fan of this place. When I linger and eat my bagel inside, Owen's neighbor, some nail place, tends to give me a headache due to the fumes.

Minimal vegan options, but these bagels are mighty tasty. I tend to go with the Cinnamon Raisin and PB. Owen's definitely caters more to the omnivores-- there are a lot of bagel sandwich options.

Though it's kinda hard to find Owen's, you'll be glad once you do. We absolutely love this place. It's awesome--especially for a big breakfast or lunch sandwich when you're super hungover. At least that's what I've found. 

Owen's is, when you get down to it, a bagel sandwich place--no more, no less (though they do have some other snacks and sides, like brownies, chips, cookies, and pasta salad). That's why you should come here. Their bagels are fresh and they have an extensive selection, from pumpernickel to Everything. 

Their sandwich combos are super creative and equally extensive. Literally, you can order any thing you think of, or something Owen's has already thought of. My girlfriend loves their Hummus and Veggie Bagel. I go for the Reuben, which comes smothered with great cheese and mustard. Check out their menu--it's amazing (with funny names too). 

Also, they steam their bagels--with the meat, cheese and veggies/sauce they've already put in it. It's interesting, but usually tastes great, so long as you dont select a sandwich best served cold.

My bacon, egg, and cheese on an everything bagel was tasty -- a solid 5-star breakfast sandwich. However, Ted's sausage, egg, and cheese on onion was pretty gross. It was something about the sausage patty. It was flavorless and mushy. Really unappetizing. 

We also attempted to share a plain bagel with the Reese's Peanut Butter cream cheese but could  only get a couple bites down. The bagel was what you'd expect, but the cream cheese was a total let down! I think it was just plain cream cheese with a couple peanut butter cups melted/steamed in there. So, the flavors were kind of sour from the plain cream cheese, sweet from the chocolate, rich from the peanut butter. Not great. 

I'm glad we tried them out. (I love trying new places!) But, unfortunately, we won't be back to Owens. I just can't bring myself to schlep to South End for a hit or miss breakfast when the incomparable Poppy's is just around the corner from our house.

Amazing. A must. I really can't emphasize this enough. YOU MUST GO TO OWEN'S! Your bagel experience will never be the same. Their steamed bagels - breakfast or sandwich style - are made to order however your heart desires, and they are a scientifically proven cure for hangovers. Fact. 
Personal fave: egg, provolone, turkey, and tomato - panini grilled to finish - on wheat bagel. Mmmmmm

Impressed! I'm from NY and it has been so hard trying to find a decent bagel/breakfast sandwich place down here. Whelp, I found one! 

First, the atmosphere is awesome. Calling all hipsters! I felt like I was in a Seattle or a San Francisco coffee shop. They had old magazine covers hung up, things were hand written and drawn. It was very comfy and inviting which makes your experience ten times better! 

Second, REAL EGGS!!!! like they crack them themselves. First place I've found down south that does this. I got the Mary's Grubby Bubby (smoked cheddar, muenster, eggs, tomato, avocado on a bialy)....YUM! This had every flavor you want in a breakfast sandwich, sweet and smoky! Usually I like a breakfast meat on my sandwiches but this sandwich doesn't even need it. The smoky cheddar makes you feel like there is bacon on it and the avocado adds just the right amount of sweet. My boyfriend got a sausage, egg, and cheese which was just as delicious-felt like we were back in NY! 

Third, the service was awesome! The girl at the register was super friendly and seemed genuinely interested in making sure we were happy. She answered our questions and talked with us about being from NY. There was a big open kitchen allowing you to see the cooking happen which is always a plus! The only suggestion I have is instead of calling out people's orders, ask for names and call those out so it's easier for customers to listen for their own name. But other than that, Owens has 5 stars in my book!
Prompt and busy. Expect a wait on weekends. Bagels are so yummy and fresh. Good variety, coffee is average. Wish they had more seating space.

Owen's is our go-to spot for bagels on the weekends.  Try Mary's Grubby Bubby or the Phish bagel sandwich.  So good.  Our kids love the chocolate cream cheese.  They have tons of sandwiches to choose from or you can build your own.  The also have coffee and Gatorade for rough mornings.  All around solid spot for breakfast!

This weekend, we decided to head down to Greenville, SC for the Fall of Greenville Festival. Before we left we made a quick stop at one of Jake and I'd favorite places, Owen's Bagels. This hole in the wall is found in the South End area in a shopping area so you really have to look for it. This quick breakfast place has an in & out atmosphere. Order your food, eat there if you choose too, and head out. Owen's has many different bagel options for you to choose from. Some are very strange compilations but so far I haven't had one I didn't like. The best part has to be the names of the Bagels! For example: A Nice Piece of Ash, Hangover Helper, Sweet Caroline, Donkey Punch, and many more! In the pictures below you will see A Nice Piece of Ash and the Angry Steve. If you're looking for some spice to start your morning, Angry Steve is the one for you. I love that they have sprouts on it. Another one I truly enjoy is the Sweet Caroline; it has a blueberry bagel with cinnamon and cream cheese inside. It's one of their simple ones.
LOVE THIS PLACE!!! My husband and I discovered it about two months ago and we have gone at least once a week since! Delicious steamed bagel sandwiches all day long, fast and well priced! Winning!!!

Best breakfast place in Charlotte! Owen's is not your average bagel shop. They're sandwiches are packed with lots of fresh ingredients. Personally I'm a fan of the Southend Special. If you live in the area or you're just visiting you have to go to Owen's! It's a fun spot with good atmosphere and music and plenty of seating. I've definitely been in here before and had to wait a long time for my sandwich so that can be frustrating, but still always worth a visit! 

Tip: they have a loyalty card! Buy a certain amount of bagels and get one free

Great bagel sandwiches that add a fresh take to the idea of a deli sandwich. Lines are always an obstacle but it's generally worth it. Flavors are always good (rarely outstanding) but this is a great asset to the area.

This is one of my favorite bagel places in Charlotte. New Yorkers- shut up. I know it isn't as good as a NY bagel. But it is delicious. 

The place is quirky. People write silly quotes on the wall. You see a lot of teenagers here (I get it- this would totally be my hangout if I were a teen). You can smell the nail polish for Polished- which is next door to them (that is gross)

The Bialy bagel is SO YUMMY. 

The menu is really overwhelming. There are plenty of vegetarian options. 

This place makes me happy.

Unreal. Most consistently impressive breakfast sandwich joint I've ever been to. The Mary's Grubby Bobby, The Dilworthian and The Fish are personal favorites, but I've never been disappointed here. Waits can be long, but the service is pretty quick and friendly,  the price is great and the coffee is solid. Eat here.

Cute and hipster bagel joint next to downtown Charlotte. We got the Mary's Grubby Hubby with poppyseed bagel and Jalapeño cream cheese and Mama's C Lox with jalapeño bagel. Both were delicious. The Mary's grubby hubby came with a soft bagel, and the mama's C lox's bagel was crunchy. get your free fountain drink when you check- in on yelp. You could also exchange it for coffee. They had ice coffee for the same price and free refills ! 
There were also memorabilia and interesting drawings all over the wall, seemed like a fun spot to hangout .

Owen's needs to move to a new location.  It is located inside a shabby mini-mall and  there is a nail salon across the hall from this restaurant from which  the odors are quite prevalent. I'm surprised that this is allowed in the health code.  I get a headache from the odors just waiting for my food and will never sit inside the restaurant to eat, which is a shame.  The inside is decorated with all kinds of things that would take an entire day to completely discover.  If the bagel shop had walls that reached up to the ceiling it would help keep the nail salon odors out.  Other than this, the bagels are fresh and there is quite an extensive and creative listing of sandwiches to choose from.  There are plenty of vegetarian and vegan choices.  Service is pretty good.  You can't expect speed when making a bagel so don't be in a hurry when you come here - just plug your nose.

I want to like this place, as I live very close, but I doubt I will go back. I'm a vegetarian, and obviously order only vegetarian bagels. Nearly EVERY time, I find bits of bacon on the bagel, and it smells of meat. Today I got it to go and couldn't return it, so I was just out the money- which is really annoying. They are very sloppy here, and also don't always listen to what you are asking for; like, "don't put it on the grill/boiler". The eggs aren't very good either. 
Basically, if you are a vegetarian or have food allergies - or just like to get what you actually order- don't go here. If you'll eat anything, you'll probably like it.

With great bagel sandwich names and wonderful combinations, Owen's Bagels is a solid locale to grab breakfast and/or lunch. The menu can be a bit overwhelming, so they have it narrowed down by the type of meat involved (which is helpful for folks who only eat certain meats). And if you go on the weekend, be prepared for a line and a bit of a wait due to the popularity of this trendy little joint. 

I've tried the following:

1. The Muenster Mash on a whole wheat bagel - Hummus, Muenster, Green Peppers, Onion, Lettuce, and Tomato. Seriously good. My favorite bagel at Owen's. No need for meat when you have all this delicious veggieness on one homemade bagel. And at only $4.00, this is a steal.

2. Sir Purr's Purrfect Bagel on whole wheat - Turkey, Veggie Cream Cheese, Smoked Cheddar, Lettuce, Tomato. I never thought I'd say this, but there was WAY too much cheese on this thing. Not sure if the maker of the sandwich was just heavy-handed with the veggie cream cheese or what, but I had to scrape a bunch of it off before I could even eat the sandwich. After that it was very good. A bit more expensive at $5.65.

3. Cinnamon Raisin Bagel with Maple Nut Cream Cheese - I do not recommend this option. The bagel barely had any raisins in it and wasn't really very cinnamon-y, either. And the maple nut cream cheese was disgusting. Go for one of the sandwiches and you'll be much happier with your experience.

Be sure to bring your appetite as the bagel sammies are quite large. And take some time to read all the funny little quips written on the walls - or write some for yourself - either way you'll be entertained. Owens is located in South End across from the Atherton Mills Market. So swing in for a bagel sammie and then run across the street for some healthy fruits and veggies. A win-win all around!

Why would you steam a bagel?!? Boiled and baked has worked fine for 400 years. Steaming just makes them soggy.

I hate leaving negative reviews, but people need to know what they're getting into. Do not go here expecting a normal bagel. Most places (including the best delis in the world) boil and then bake them.  A few places like Owens are experimenting with steaming them instead. Problem is, they come out soggy! Especially if you get one to go, that's sat in foil paper. This is why these places aren't catching on. My order was a simple bagel with egg, and it was a soggy mess. It fell apart while I was eating it, like I was eating lumpy oatmeal with my hands.

I think people's opinions of this place are skewed because it's a hip bohemian-ish atmosphere with writing on concrete walls, old furniture, etc. It's a very Charlotte thing to do. We love our gentrified pretend hole in the wall. But I'm sorry, this place wouldn't last a week somewhere like NYC.

If you want a great bagel, do yourself a favor, and go somewhere like Poppy's. Get a real bagel, prepared properly just as they have been for centuries.

I love the food here, but service is truly awful. I came in today for a late lunch (1:30) and immediately noticed two ladies smoking right outside the door. At a bar? fine. At a dining establishment? Not acceptable. I walked in and realized that the two women smoking were the employees. One should be at least inside waiting for customers and the smoking should be done away from the front entrance. 

Anyway I went with one of their turkey sandwiches and asked to add tomato and veggie cream cheese and that my bagel be toasted. I realize this was a special order however, considering I was the only customer  it shouldn't have been that difficult to get right.

I also tried to be friendly and chat - and in response received not a smile, nothing. Not sure if it was just a bad day for them, but I couldn't help but feel as though they were irritated that I interrupted their smoke break.  

I got all the way to work only to realize my bagel wasn't toasted...which as a New York native is a big no-no . It still tasted good, but I always toast my bagels even at home so I was really disappointed. 

Considering they have gotten my order wrong more times than not, I may have to try poppy's in order to get my bagel fix. This makes me sad since Owen's has such a cool vibe and pretty darn good bagels.

This place is amazing. The vibe is cool with music blasting, writing on the walls and friendly staff. 

While the wait was longer than I anticipated (15+ minutes) it was well worth it. I ordered the Angry Steve and it did not disappoint. It was a hearty breakfast sandwich. My boyfriend ordered Ya Boi which is similar to the Crunch and Munch at Bagel and Deli at Miami University in Oxford, OH. He gave it a 5 star rating.

I will definitely be back. I plan to print off a menu and cross off the ones I've tried. There are so many it's hard to choose!

This review is based solely off my reuben experience - this rating could vary significantly with something more common from Owen's.

A bagel place offering a reuben is certainly an interesting option, and I was excited to continue my reuben adventure with this unique take on the classic sandwich. I wish I had tried something more common (although that wouldn't have worked well to continue my journey around Charlotte to try all of the reubens the city has to offer).

The reubagel, as I decided to call it, just didn't have a setup for success. A bagel is significantly thicker than any rye bread you're going to find, so I think it has to be overstuffed (NYC style) to really get the proper proportions. Sadly, this one was not. Each bite tasted like bagel with a little bit of meat and cheese mixed in. The middle ingredients were fairly common, with average corned beef, very little kraut, good swiss but lacking in quantity, and a russain dressing that was a little sweeter than what works for a reuben. The pumpernickel rye bagel was tasty, but that was too be expected from a bagel place. I don't recommend trying the reubagel as there are far better options on the menu.

i walk here constantly and love owens.  they have very creative bagel sammy combos and good coffee.  i like going for bfast or lunch, mandy's mayhem or mark cuban look-a-like are both my jams.  they're in a neat space and if you would like a lap dance with your bagel and coffee you just have to walk across the street to leather and lace

I can't believe I've never been here. It's been a sound end staple for a while.

Piece of advice... on Sunday early morning there is loud rap music playing.  This is perfect for getting ready for a Sunday funday or really loud if you had a long night before .  When I walked it I felt like I was in a different city.  The graffiti and decor is eclectic and fun. 

The line was really long but moved fast.  I found that a lot of people were calling in their orders and taking them outside to enjoy the amazing weather.

You order at the counter, grab a number, and there are water cups while you wait. 

I got the everything bagel with veggie cream cheese and my husband got the everything BEC.  

I really liked my bagel a lot!  I have never had a steamed bagel and it was a nice surprise.  I will be back.

Forget your chains like Bruegger's or Einsteins.  Take advantage of Owen's Bagel & Deli.  Their bagels are far more NY authentic and less commercial quality.  They toast, they steam, and they have a menu that can't be beat.  I tend to drop in once a week at breakfast.  Not a great coffee selection but it's also not a coffeehouse so I can't base the review on that.  

I tend to grab an Everything w Cream Cheese, a Breakfast Bagel, the Hangover Helper, or Mary's Grubby Bubby (pictured : Egg, Muenster, Smoked Cheddar, Avacado, Tomato on a Bialy).  Grubby Bubby is so so good and fresh.  All fantastic.  Best in Charlotte.

These people were working so hard to get breakfast to hungry Charlotteans on Sunday! I was very impressed with the staff while they were absolutely slammed! Ive seen this place a thousand times but didn't actually know how big it is inside or how busy they get. 

The menu has about 10,000 choices so it was really hard to make a decision. Went with one of the specials, which was a cubano bagel. My only complaint is that the pulled pork on my bagel was really dry. I would just get something else next time!

I love bagels.  Whenever I go to New York, I have to get a bagel from one of the carts on the street, and at least one from a deli with a breakfast sandwich on it.  I love bagels so much that it's almost worth going to New York City just for the bagels.  I'm sorry, but places like Brueggers and Einstein Brothers just aren't the same (as decent as they are).

The bagels at Owen's, however, are different.  I don't know if they are the match of New York bagels, but they are awfully close.  The one thing you have to know - as has been mentioned - is that the bagels are steamed, rather than toasted.  It's a little different, but not entirely bad.  Just go in expecting it and you'll probably be okay.

Once you get past that, you'll find that the ingredients definitely set the place apart.  It's worth the trip.  You do have to have a bit of funk in you, as the walls are covered with quasi-graffiti, but it's not bad.

Hole in the wall place; reminds me of breakfast spots by college campuses. Good for a quick bagel to go, line moves fast and menu is overwhelming so I just go with my usual poppy toasted regular cream cheese. Take your sandwich across the street to Not Just Coffee for seating and better drinks.

Decided to try Owens bagels again and rating it a 4! Friendly service and their sweet Caroline was delicious! Bagel was warm, soft, sweet, everything I expected it to be. Had the right amount of sweetness to it. Also tried their Mary's grubby a good hangover bagel. Def worth trying all three!
I love this place! The menu is creative and the quality is consistent. I would recommend this to anyone!

A laid back and fun atmosphere. As I sit here writing this, Nikki Minaj is blasting through the speakers and it makes for the perfect place to follow up my Saturday night. They offer lots of creative options and gluten-free and vegan as well! Which is great because I have several friends who fall into this category and it's always tough to find a place for breakfast when they visit. 

Parking can be tricky and the line does get long but their steamed bagels and sandwich creations are worth the visit. They don't try to hard and that's what I like about it. From the handcrafted menus, wiring on the walls and delicious food, you're sure to be glad you came.

I was finally able to try Owen's for the first time today, and the visit was a mix of good and bad.
The good: the quality of the food was solid. I ordered Mary's gubby bubby, and the bagel was excellent. It was perfectly steamed and still somewhat soft despite being a denser type of bread. The other ingredients were fresh too, but the bagel really shined. 
The bad: it took almost 15 minutes to get my bagel. It wasn't unusually busy and the workers seemed to be going pretty quickly but it was a bit slower than I expected. The taste of the bagel was good but nothing really stood out as outstanding, either. The eggs seemed microwaved or re-warmed and other than the bagel, nothing impressed me. My biggest complaint: the size/price. The bagel sandwich I got was tiny - much smaller than bagels from other bakeries or even what you would get from the supermarket. It was fairly tasty, but for $6+ and a 15 minute wait, I would expect a much larger bagel.
Overall, the bagel impressed me, so I might be willing to come back, but everything else left me pretty disappointed.

I love me some bagels. Large doughy goodness and covered with schmear, please. And Owen's Bagel & Deli certainly delivers - in a big, creative, steamy way. 

I've frequented Owen's many a time and I always appreciate the local, hippy vibe that rocks through the scrawled upon walls. It's a very casual haunt, where you can grab some morning breakfast or a quick lunch. You'll see all sorts of customers here - from the church crowd to the hungover college kids. The bagel connoisseurs who work at Owen's are very laid back and friendly. Be prepared to chuckle while reading their menu - they have incredibly creative sandwich names like The Mark Cuban and The Tonya Harding Club. 

While I've tried many delicious bagel sammies here, but I always go back to my old standby - the Banana Surprise. It's a cinnamon raisin bagel, slathered with cream cheese, covered in bananas and a dusting of cinnamon sugar. It's incredible. Husband always orders a Mr. Turkey with egg, also a delicious choice. All the bagels and bagel sandwiches are steamed and that makes them super tasty and chewy. Oh, and their coffee is local, which just makes me love them even more. 

Head on over to Owen's for a monstrous steamed bagel sandwich, and if you're not full enough, make sure you grab a cookie on the way out - they are the size of your face and a sugary dream.

I like supporting a local business and this is a good one. My go to here is a bacon egg and cheese on a plain. It takes a few minutes to prepare it which is fine. It is extremely soft and gooey and tasty after steeping it. It's really good but also over $5 just for the sandwich which pulled the rating down a star.

I don't think I've ever actually written a love letter, so I guess it's time to change that. 

Dear Owen's, I love you. I don't care how long the line is, you are always worth the wait. You make me happy when skies are gray and are the perfect remedy for my worst hangover. I would totally be in a committed Facebook relationship with you. Translation: that's a huge deal. When you had to temporarily close because a car ran through the wall, I felt like a family member had died. 

I discovered Owen's about ten years or so ago when they first opened. I selfishly wanted to keep it a secret. It's tucked on the end of the little shopping center on South Blvd next to Polished. Leather and Lace is on the other side of it. Don't stare directly at it during daylight hours.

So what do you need to know?
*There's a line on the weekends. It moves quickly. Be patient. 
*Home of the steamed bagel! Ton of options (including veggie) on the menu. You can even build your own. If you can't find something you like here, then maybe you should talk to yourself in the mirror. The problem may be you.
*There's graffiti all over the walls
*Don't see a spot in front? There's a parking lot behind it

I don't have a go-to order here because I like too many things here. My new current-crush and go-to is the Nice Piece of Ash. Great name. It's like a Kool Jules or South End Special on steroids. Who's Ash? She's the owner and a local Johnson & Wales Alum. That's right. Locally owned. 

Owen's also does catering and you can call in your pick-up order ahead of time. They also have giant pickles. I ask for it cut in four pieces and then I don't share them with anyone. Hours alert: they close at 2pm on Mondays and 3pm all the other days.

Very good.  The owner/workers clearly have a passion for food.  Parking and finding the doorway are slightly confusing, but no biggie.  Had a lox bagel w/ capers.  Prices were just a little high for what it was, but I'll go back and support this place.

This place is awesome and one of Charlotte's best kept secrets! Really laid back ambiance and the perfect spot to grab your favorite bagel sandwich. The manager and staff are super friendly and actually care about their patrons, which is why this place continue to grow. Highly recommend for a delicious, quick breakfast!

I wish I lived in CLT solely so I could start every Saturday morning off with a bagel from here. The "Nice Piece of Ash" is HUGE and has so many ingredients but is so delicious. Get here early - the line will be out the door, but they do a good job keeping the line moving. I also appreciate the music they play - it gets pretty hype at 8:30am!
Great breakfast bagel and amazing atomosphere will be back to to try again soon.

Would easily be 5 stars but if you like horrible loud rap and a shitty atmosphere ...best bagels and service, worst building ever! Between the horrible smelling nail place that is open air to Owens and the rotten always broken and not serviced bathroom it's a real detractor from a place that has much more potential.

Parking is a little tricky, but it's totally worth it for this local gem! I'm a traditional sesame and cream cheese kind of girl, but the friendly guy at the counter suggested the pimento BLT on asiago, and I went for it. Hot and melty and crispy and quite possibly this BEST bagel sandwich I have ever had. I want it again tomorrow!

Delicious - reminds me of bodo's bagels in Charlottesville, VA.  The only genuine home grown bagel place I know of in Charlotte.  Customers have written all over the wall - fun to read while you are waiting for your scrumptious bagel sandwich!

Best bagel place in Charlotte - you can tell because it is always packed on the weekends and it also has a prime location in Southend. Their bagels are steamed and delicious, you can't go wrong with any of their speciality sandwiches. My go to is either a classic bacon egg and cheese on an everything bagel or the Angry Steve (egg, sausage, cheese, peppers, onions and spicy ranch). I will say they are small so get 2 if you are used to huge NYC bagels!

This is what I call a bagel shop! I got a turkey sausage egg and cheese with chive cream cheese.. The food is awesome, ambiance is awesome, staff is awesome, service is awesome and I love how they value their employees.. they look happy! I will be back.
Breakfast bagel on toasted asiago cheese bagel sausage egg and cheese with Swiss. This is absolutely awesome!

Love this place!  The first time I went (a few years ago) I was weary about getting a steamed bagel ( I love my toasted NY bagels) but it was delish!  I started out with 'safer' bagel options, the Sweet Caroline (blueberry bagel, cream cheese and cinnamon & sugar) delish and a good 1st timer bagel- but I still get it all the time!  I have since tried various sandwich bagels and have never been disappointed, they will let you add or remove items to your liking with no problem.
When my husband found out that there was an Owen's in Charlotte he was excited, being a Miami of Ohio alum he ate there all the time in college-
I can't say anything about the coffee, because I don't drink it- but I'm sure if you aren't happy with the temp, you can ask them for some fresh coffee and they would be happy to accommodate

We frequent Owen's a lot and love it every time!

I don't even know where to start with these guys..It always takes FOREVER for your food, even when you're the only one in there..bagels..well, they're flippin' steamed..who the F*CK does that..no toaster? seriously? why the hell do I want a chewy mutha f*ckin' bagel?..Cream cheese, bland...the people that work there are complete morons.. 

the decor and the deserts are the ONLY positive thing about this place...oh yeah..the chips..those are good b/c well...they already come made

This place is really good. I had order a Mama's Lox bagel, and my boyfriend ordered an Angry Steve. I was so excited to eat my bagel and to my surprise I ate my boyfriends bagel by mistake. It was so good. Really spicy but worth it. I'll have to go back to try the Mama lox one now since I ate the other one.
Awesome and creative bagels! Not your ordinary deli place. There is a large selection of menu items to pick from. The staff is very friendly and the prices are reasonable.

I've never had a steamed bagel before, but after hearing so many good things about Owen's Bagel, my husband and I (finally!) had to give them a try.  They are a bit tricky to find, located in The Pavilion, a small strip shopping center across from Atherton Mill.  

Once we found parking, we headed inside.  Owen's is located inside The Pavilion, and they have a fun and quirky vibe.  You stand in line and order at the counter, then wait for your number to be called to pick up your food.  There are a few seats inside, as well as seats in The Pavilion and outside the back door.  

The first time, I ordered a plain bagel with egg, cheddar, and avocado, and my husband got a sesame bagel with bacon, egg, and American cheese.  After waiting about 10-15 minutes on a busy Saturday, we picked up our order.  The bagels were hot (from the steaming!), and were absolutely delicious.  My avocado bagel was loaded with scrambled eggs, avocado, and cheddar.  It was soft, cheesy, and just wonderful.  My husband's bacon bagel was similarly good, and he preferred the American cheese.  

The second visit I ordered Mary's Grubby Bubby, another vegetarian option with a tomato, avocado, Muenster and cheddar cheese, and scrambled egg on a bialy.  I've had bialys before and this one seemed fatter, like the usual bagel, but it was absolutely delicious.  It's my new favorite!  My husband got the standard bacon, egg, and cheese again, but he also got a steamed cream cheese bagel.  I had some of that the cream cheese bagel, and it was so good!  

Coffee is served one size, and they have two flavors - bold and light.  The bold satisfied our desire for strong coffee!

We'll definitely be back!
Best bagels in the nation!  Since visiting NC, this was by far the tastiest food I've had.  If you're into the spices, you gotta try the Mateo Ranchero

No toaster. NO TOASTER. WHY must the best bagels in CLT be forced into a sauna to steam away all their crusty, crunchy potential?

Toppings are diverse, coffee is good. Staff is cute and stoned. Decor is rad, and I feel totally comfy, until EVERYTHING IN MY 6 DOLLAR BREKKIE SAMMICH comes pouring out, onto my lap, onto my dry-clean-only Interview Shirt, and then that's it - I'm throwing a tantrum (in my head at least) and tossing the wet mess into the bin. Give us the option, kids. Don't be Steamer Fascists.
March 11 2016 , second visit Tried chia sandwhich was great , tried veggie cheese was great . a should try place . best time to go mornings

This is a great place to go if you have small kids and time. The wait for getting your food can be a little long so if you're in a hurry to get back to work then maybe this isn't the right place for you.

If you have some time and want a great bagel sandwich with a laid back atmosphere then you don't want to miss stopping by here. The walls are covered with graffiti (don't be afraid to add your own) and the music is an ecclectic mix. There is even a play area for smaller children with toys and books.

The sandwiches are made on real NY bagels and are steamed. I prefer mine toasted and they can do that too. I've had a few of their cleverly named sandwiches and you can even invent your own for them if you'd like. The breakfast sandwiches are great and filling. They even off free trade coffee along with a great mix of teas. During the winter months they offer a new soup each day which is delicious and satisfying. I love this place.

This is a fun spot to grab a quick(ish) lunch. The people there are always nice. I mix up my order but most recently got "a nice piece of ash" and they were more than patient with all of my modifications. It was made fresh and the steamed bagel was perfect. I got the bagel and a homemade rice crispy treat and it was about $10, which (to me) is a little steep but I like supporting a local spot so it's cool. The few times I've had a fountain drink, it's been flat but I haven't had it enough to say it's always that way. 

Overall, a good spot.

The bagels here are fantastic. I have always enjoyed the variety as well as the service. HOWEVER, the iced coffee here was the worst coffee I have ever had in my entire life. It was absolutely disgusting. DO NOT EVER GET THE ICED COFFEE.

I have become a huge Owen's fan. This funky little spot hidden from the street inside the Pavilion in the South End is worth finding. It has amazing character, with its off beat decor and sharpie decorated tables. 

But the real reason I visit Owen's is for the bagels. We transplanted New Yorkers are at a loss for real bagels - most of CLT is dominated by bagel chains that serve soft, doughy round rolls and call them bagels. Owen's has the real deal - dense, chewy, with real bite. 

I have become addicted to a cream cheese I'd never have tasted prior to my CLT move. Bacon, ranch, scallion cream cheese - salty, tangy, tasty, perfect on a toasted sesame bagel. Owen's also offers sandwiches and fun, creative options for bagel based food. Try it. You won't be sorry!

I love this place! Today I went for lunch and got a customized bagel. Everything bagel with bacon, pepper jack cheese, and cream cheese. I also got a coffee and cheese grits. The coffee was amazing and brewed to perfection. They accidentally added egg to my bagel so they instantly remade it and even gave me the egg one to give away. The bagel was hot and delicious. I definitely will be going back and recommending this place to everyone. The staff is always so nice and friendly as well!
Get the Mary's grubby bubby. I think I ate one every weekend for two years. Oops. You can bring in your pup too.

I loved this place. I love how deconstructed the décor is, form the unfinished wall, to the endless graffiti, the clothesline menu, etc. I love the laid back concept where anyone can just go hangout and write on pretty much anything.

The bagels were excellent. I had the Nova Lox with capers and onions. Delicious. When we went it was pretty empty but it was like a Tuesday around 11 or something like that.

The staff were very helpful and friendly. They explained about their bagels and preparation methods, etc.

I am a fan!

Love the bagels here - einsteinium could learn a thing or two from this local down to earth place. There's no frills and that's why I like it - come in get a bagel and a coffee, eat it and go. That's what it's all about. Very we'll done

Hands down the best bagel place in Charlotte. We've been here several times and had Mary's Grubby Bubby, Nice Piece of Ash, South End Special, Ya Boi, and Phillipa's Phetish. Every single one was amazing. The steamed bagels are great. We'll definitely be coming back to sample more of the menu

Absolutely LOVE Owens bagels!!! Being a northern girl in the south I have to have a go-to bagel place and this little gem in South End is my place ! Love the laid back ambience and the funny/quirky names of their bagel sandwiches. You can order the sandwiches "as-is" or build your own. I also love all the amazing flavored cream cheeses; they always have their creative constants like bacon ranch and jalapeño but they also will sometimes throw in another wacky seasonal to see how it's liked. My stand-by recipe is the Mama Cs lox with jalapeño on everything I definitely recommend it if you want something filling, with a good balance of breakfast and lunch. My boyfriends go-to is the Grubby Bubby or the pimento BLT - both are AWESOME and I always have to steal a bite .. Or two. Great place, great bagels -- efficient service whether busy or slow , check this spot out if you haven't !!!

Bacon, egg, and pimento cheese bagel- ie the perfect cure for a hungry weekend morning. Bagels are steamed unless you ask otherwise, which isn't a bad thing. Long line, but definitely a must visit establishment in Charlotte.

After all the years I've lived in Charlotte, I had never been to Owen's. I mean, how different could THESE bagels be? Bagel sandwiches, done before --or so I thought. I wasn't aware of the whole steamed bagel concept. 

On my maiden voyage I ordered the chicken salad special and my lunch date had the Tonya Harding. His was much better than mine  but I have to say, the bagels were just soooo good. I have definitely been missing out. Will be trying the egg sandwich and other options in the near future. I am sort of obsessing about trying more and more steamed bagel options and sort of wish I kept myself in the dark.

If you haven't gone to Owen's - go!

It's baaaaaccckkkk *In the style of Carol Anne*

A car smashing through your wall is not a thing to take lightly, but you would never know it happened. Kudos to the construction team. 
Owens is just wonderful. These are steamed bagels, so no, NY and NJ, they're not your typical type of bagels. I don't think they're trying to be. They have a big menu, I truly haven't had anything I dislike. They always provide fresh ingredients and really quick service. My only dislike is that they don't have a second location!

They're awesome about substitutions with their sandwiches, so don't be afraid to ask if you don't like something, or you want another flavor bagel. 

I'll admit, one of my favorite things to do here is play "where's the quote" with other people I'm with. 

Can you find: "DEEZ NUTS! Ha.... GOT EM!" ? Good luck, yelpers.
Ordered 2 of the nice piece of Ash, great sandwich bagel, wife is hooked on Owens bagels now. Very friendly staff. On my list to go too for breakfast or lunch.

Bagels are a staple of American culture. Owen's is a staple of Charlotte culture. Everything about it screams classic bagel joint. For a morning bagel breakfast in the QC, this is the place to go. And if you are looking for a twist on the classic egg sandwich, the Mary's grubby bubby is phenomenal

Owens is so delicious! Immediately became my go to bagel stop. Obsessed with their spinach cream cheese. It is literally spinach infused cream cheese and it's a must try. I've never seen anything like it before! I recommend trying your bagel steamed. I have never heard of that before and It's amazing. Such a fun atmosphere with up beat staff and music. Enjoy sitting outside as well with your pup!

This place is the absolute best place to stop in Charlotte for a quick breakfast or lunch bagel. The staff is always super friendly, always a clean atmosphere and great vibe. The menu is huge and has so much great stuff to choose from, so I recommend picking the "Lottery Bagel" option where the staff picks their favorite to make for you. Never disappointed when leaving here. Not to mention the owner/manager is the BOMB!

If you're visiting the city or haven't tried this place yet, DO IT!

Although there is always a line, it is well worth it! And, it just shows how great Owen's is. The bagels are awesome and Ashley, the owner, and the staff are on top of everything and always have a great attitude. 

Love that Owen's will only be a block away after I move this weekend.

Owens is great. The food is always fresh and if you get there early enough you can avoid the long line. I prefer the Angry Steve for a little spice. The service is also always good but expect to wait for your bagels because they usually are busy!

Bagel bacon egg and cheese with a large cup of fresh brewed coffee is the only reason I'm up before 9am on a Saturday morning! Got to beat the long line that forms quickly at Owen's Bagel & Deli.

The walls are covered in "local artist" hand work, staff is friendly and the food literally will cure any hangover. Parking can be a little dicey but it's so worth it. Upon entering is a board to the left that lists all the types of bagels and spreads then grab a menu and wait in line.

Places like this are rare now that Southend is bringing in the new and pushing out the old. We need to support places like Owen's, Common Market, Phat Burrito that not only remind us of what makes charlotte so awesome, but what keeps up coming back for more.

I love Owen's bagels. Interesting and creative bagel sandwiches on top of really yummy bagels. Sure, they have "plain" but who wants a plain bagel when you can have onion or garlic or everything?

It was a late start on Sunday for us, landing at Owen's at 1:30 in the afternoon. A little sad to see that they had already run out of coffee, but we were satisfied to find a Dr. Brown's cream soda in the fridge.

Excellent salmon on a bagel with capers for Mrs. K. A lovely bagel with egg and cheese and ham for me. Delish. Just sad about the coffee.

Stumbled upon this place- im from out of town. I had the psychadeli bagel and it was delicious! I wish we had this spot where I live. Everyone's so friendly and it's hard to be anything but happy in this atmosphere- great choice of music too. I would definitely come back.

Love Owen's Bagels.
Have only been here a limited number of times, why? How dare I deprive myself of deliciousness?

This time I got the Reuben bagel, pretty good but I was overcome with jealousy when my fiance asked for the workers to surprise him..

Ashley (Owen's employee) made what she calls "A nice piece of Ash" her signature bagel, IT WAS AMAZING!

Thick slices of meat and bacon, sprouts and some other ingredients that made me super jelly!


I will be back and hope Ashley will be there so I can get a piece of that!

This is a convenient spot for me, whenever I finished getting my nails done, I will hop over to get a blueberry bagel.  I've also tried their breakfast bagel, they are super delicious as well.  Highly recommended!

I also show them my phone one time for qualifying the FREE soft drink for frequent check-ins and I don't know any other shop owner will make that exception, they usually ask you to print out what you have on your phone or give them some coupon in print, but I like it when they are flexible and I would definitely come back for more whenever I crave for breakfast or bagels!!!

We had to check out all the hype a couple of days ago. I wish I would have known you can call your order in for pick up, the line was gnarly. Luckily, Owen's is pretty festive with plenty of things to look and read. I ordered the Grubby Bubby on an Everything Bagel and added jalapeno CC (per yelper's suggestion) while the boyfriend got the Mayberry Captain Midnight. I paid about $13 altogether. It took a little to come out since it was crowded, but I appreciate the fact that they call out the orders exactly how they are placed to avoid mix-ups. The Grubby Bubby came out huge compared to the MCM, the bialy bagel is pretty slim. The chicken salad on the MCM had good flavor but the chicken was overcooked and dry. The Grubby Bubby came out amazing as expected. The added jalapeno cream cheese is so worth it. 

I will be back to try out more bagel sandwiches but I'll be placing my order via phone for easy pick up. Cheers!

A good bagel sandwich starts with a good bagel. I love Owens because they sell a quality product. I used to get their signature recipes every time but I have started just making up my own recipes of combos that I like for breakfast or lunch. The great think about Owens is the have lots of vegan and vegetarian options.
This is the best sandwich in Charlotte by far. Good service, great atmosphere and the Phish sandwich will have you back again and again.

Best bagel sandwich ever! The selection is great. The line tells it all, but it moves fast. The staff is very friendly.  If you are in Charlotte, have a bite here. You won't leave hungry, but you will leave happy!
The steamed bagel sandwiches and coffee are great.  There is a ton of menu variety, but just avoid the bacon, as it is always chewy and never crisp.

So Scrumptious, but whoooooa busy!!

The food is amazing, but there is always so many people there! Their staff has it down for getting orders in, but with how many orders they take - it does take time. 

Best tip about this place: there is outdoor seating

I popped in here for the first time with my boyfriend this weekend - we went to school at Miami University so we had to check out the place that was based off the original we loved!

I got the Gwacka Flocka Flame, which I loved - it was meaty and creamy and spicy and just perfect. My boyfriend got the Nice Piece of Ash, and while he liked it he said he'd had much better. Hands down the best bagels I have found since moving to Charlotte though!

The restaurant space itself is like 4x the size of the one in Oxford which is nice, but it was also SO much slower than we were used to (but equally as busy). Chances are we will be back, but it's hard to give them an over-the-top review when comparing to the original.
Solid spot where they steam their bagels / sandwiches. Crowds and line can be a pain, but that's a testament to their food. Parking needs to be improved to make this spot a daily go to.
Food is great. Place is way too hipster for the angry curmudgeon I have become. Go and enjoy the bright-eyed youth until life drains the color from their fresh, happy faces.

Can't say enough good things about this place. The staff is always friendly, the atmosphere is always like a party.
Some tips get there early and know what you want to order to help keep the line moving...I haven't had a bad sandwich from here yet...Hangover Helper for the win!!!!

The best bagel sandwiches in town. I LOVE steamed bagels and Owens does not disappoint. A ton of different options on the menu and you can modify anything. I was born in Wheeling, WV so when I saw the Dicarlo's pizza bagel I had to get it. Delicious.

You will wait (if you don't call ahead), but it will be worth it. With that being said.. call your order in before you go. They usually have a separate line where you can pickup call ahead orders too. If they don't pick up the first time you try calling, call again.

While there are plenty of options, I tend to go the traditional bacon, egg and cheese route. With pimento cheese, of course.

Check in on Yelp for a free fountain beverage! They do also have a frequent buyer card that you after you buy 10, you get one free. 

Seating is fairly limited, and with how many people are usually waiting, I prefer to just order to go. However, there are about 10-15 tables if you can snag one and don't mind people standing around you while you eat. You will be too enthralled by your sandwich to really even notice.

Was a little confusing the first time figuring out how to get inside. They are located in a multi-tenant building, so you will need to walk into the establishment's main doors, and will then see the entrance to Owen's on your right.

So glad Owen's is back up and running after being closed for some time (kitchen fire? - Now I'm just spreading gossip).  What is NOT gossip are how good their steamed bagel sandwiches are here.

Located in an unassuming end of a shopping center right off of South Blvd, you can easily miss this place if you are zooming down the road.  Once you find parking (usually in the back) you can go in, get your bearings.  They share space in the Pavilion in South End, so once you navigate to their side of the Pavillion, grab a menu (that's rather large and in charge) and calmly wait in line.  They have a bunch of stuff to look at while you are in line.  Their menu offerings - I call it artwork, but I am thinking the artwork is contributed by the tireless and hardworking staff at Owens.

The Hangover Helper has worked miracles for me, but really everything on their menu is amazing.  They have something for everyone too - breakfast person, non-meat eating person, bacon person, it's a smorgasbord of deliciousness when you come here.

Definitely a great GEM in the South End Community.... Owens is changing the world "one bagel at a time" like their motto suggests.

Since I pledged to support local for a whole month I took a detour from my usual stops at those chain bagel places to check out Owen's.

Owen's sits inside the Pavillion which is across South Blvd from Atherton Mill.  It's a funly place with eclectic decor from sports pennants to chalkboard signs.  Their menu is quite extensive of breakfast and deli sandwiches and they feature Boar's Head deli meats.

I ordered the Hangover Helper bagel sandwich which consisted of ham, egg and smoked gouda cheese.  Just the smell of the smoked gouda told me I was about to have a Foodgasm.  The bagel itself was soft, the ham was stuffed on it and the gouda...mmmmmmmmmm.  One of my favorite cheeses.  

The staff is very friendly here.  There's plenty of tables in the space and fountain drinks are help yourself.  

You definite get your money's worth here.

Delicious bagel, but soft on the outside because they steam them.  I enjoyed an egg, turkey sausage, and cheddar cheese sandwich on an everything bagel.  The cheddar cheese was perfectly melted.  While I love the sandwich, I prefer my bagels to be crunchy on the outside and soft inside. But, I will go back!

I'm not a big fan of this place, although I was only here once for lunch.

Parking here can be a bit tight, but the interior of this bagel shop is fairly spacious.  Somehow, the atmosphere on the particular afternoon I visited stressed me out.  A family with two screaming kids, spilling things on the floor.  The employees appeared to be squabbling over something or other and loudly calling out ingredients that they needed.  The layout is also a bit confusing with menus on one end, payment on the other that was opposite to guest traffic.  The staff on this day was a bit surly.

I did like the open, industrial vibe with writing on the walls and a variety of news magazine covers on the walls.

The lunch bagels have fun names and neat meat and veggie combinations.  I had a turkey, avocado, bacon and cheese bagel.  Steamed bagels are a strange concept for me.  I'm not a fan.  Bagels packed To Go will steam on their own in the wrapper, so why steam them to start?  All in all, I guess I like my bagels toasted and to eat them in a relaxing environment.  It's a matter of preference.

So happy I found this little gem. If you are the least bit hungover, these bagel sandwiches will literally save you. Very casual atmoshere- one thing to note, they steam their bagels (no toasting)...When I first learned this I was weary but they are delicious! Oh and the bagels come straight from NY. Try and get there on the early side because they run out of the good bagels (everything) quick on weekends. This has shattered my world on many occasions.

Awesome local bagel shop with a massive menu. I had a basic bacon, egg and cheese and it was much better than anything you'd get at Brueggers. Even the simple bagel/cream cheese was awesome. I can't believe I've never been here but I can't wait to go back.
